0.title: KL Rahul could be top run-scorer for India at T20 WC 2022: Aakash Chopra
0.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said opener KL Rahul could be the top run-scorer for India at upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. "He has an opportunity to bat all 20 overs, and...also has the game to bat till the end. These pitches will suit him a lot as the ball will come nicely onto the bat," he added.

1.title: No plans to buy Jaiprakash Associates' cement unit: Adani Enterprises
1.article_body: Adani Enterprises clarified it is not evaluating plans to buy Jaiprakash Associates' cement unit. This development comes amid reports that the firm was in advanced discussion with Jaiprakash Power Ventures to acquire its cement unit for around ₹5,000 crore. Adani Enterprises said, "Company isn't evaluating any such proposal...not in a position to comment on the veracity of said media report."

2.title: India-UK FTA no longer has a Diwali deadline: UK Trade Secretary
2.article_body: India-UK free trade agreement (FTA) is no longer working towards a Diwali deadline, UK Trade Secretary Kemi Badenoch said. "We're still working on a deal...things that have changed...we're no longer working to the Diwali deadline," Badenoch said. This comes amid reports of possible deadlock over issues like data localisation and UK firms being allowed to bid for Indian government contracts.

3.title: 9 students drown after ferry capsizes in Cambodia
3.article_body: At least nine children in southern Cambodia who were crossing a river died after the boat they were on capsized on Thursday, officials said. The students, aged between 12 and 14, were on their way to an English class when their boat capsized on the Mekong River. Four people, two students and two of the boat's crew, have been rescued.

4.title: Photographer captures 'ghost rainbow' in US, pic goes viral
4.article_body: A photographer named Stu Berman shared the photo of a 'ghost rainbow' captured by him in California. Also called fogbow or white rainbow, it's caused by the same physical process as the rainbow, except the water droplets that form the fogbow are very small. This causes heightened diffraction that leads to the appearance of weak colours or no colours.

5.title: Will approach SC: Lawyer after Gyanvapi 'Shivling' carbon dating rejection
5.article_body: After a Varanasi Court rejected the plea of Hindu worshippers regarding carbon dating of 'Shivling' in the Gyanvapi mosque case, Advocate Vishnu Jain said that they will now move to Supreme Court against this order and challenge it there. "I cannot announce the date as of now, but we'll soon challenge this order in Supreme Court," he added.

6.title: Couple blackmails MLAs, film producers using intimate pics & extort crores in Odisha
6.article_body: A woman in her 20s and her husband were recently arrested for allegedly extorting crores of rupees from influential people such as MLAs, businessmen and film producers in Odisha, police said. The couple, identified as Archana Nag and Jagabandu Chand, allegedly ran a sex racket to extort influential persons by threatening to make their intimate pictures public.

7.title: Felt cheated, nobody expected it to be animated film: Vishnu on 'Adipurush'
7.article_body: Telugu actor Vishnu Manchu said in an interview that he "felt cheated" when he saw the teaser of 'Adipurush'. He added that nobody expected it to be an animated film. "We all thought...it'll be a mainstream live-action movie," said Vishnu. "If you would've said...it was an animated film, and then released the teaser, there would've been zero trolls," he added.

8.title: Class 10 boy's kidneys swell after being forced to do 200 sit-ups in Guj school
8.article_body: A Class 10 student was hospitalised after he was allegedly made to do 200 sit-ups as punishment by a school teacher in Gujarat's Una. The boy has been diagnosed with swelling in his kidneys. His father alleged that about seven to 10 days ago, when his son returned from school, he complained of cramps in his legs and vomited constantly.

9.title: Never thought we would see 4 sixes in final over at T20 WC 2016: Sammy
9.article_body: Ex-West Indies skipper Daren Sammy remembered the last over of the 2016 T20 World Cup final where Carlos Brathwaite helped his team to win the title by smashing four sixes. "I remember Chris [Gayle] saying that 19 [runs in the last over] is a lot. But...Man oh man, I never thought we would see four [consecutive] sixes," Sammy said.

10.title: Rasika Dugal wraps up shooting for 'Mirzapur 3'
10.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal has completed shooting for the third season of the web series 'Mirzapur'. The actress, who plays a character named Beena Tripathi on the show, said that she will miss being on the sets and collaborating with her "favourite people". In addition to Rasika, 'Mirzapur 3' will also feature Pankaj Tripathi and Ali Fazal, among others.

11.title: Govt says OTP can be stolen via calls, urges public to stay alert & aware
11.article_body: Press Information Bureau shared a video on Twitter saying that One Time Password (OTP) can be stolen via calls. "Never merge any other calls while talking to a stranger on the phone...Once the call is merged, the fraudster can hack your social media account by knowing the OTP...Be aware, be alert," the tweet read.

12.title: Crimea bridge repairs will be completed by July next year: Russia
12.article_body: Repairs to the bridge linking southern Russia with the annexed Crimean peninsula will be completed by July 2023, a document published on the Russian government's website said. The bridge was damaged in an explosion last Saturday. Russian President Vladimir Putin blamed Ukraine's special services for the Crimea bridge blast and called it an "act of terrorism".

13.title: Russia to evacuate Kherson residents amid Ukraine's advances
13.article_body: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin announced that the country would provide free accommodation to residents of the Kherson region who want to evacuate to Russia. The announcement came after Russia-backed leader of Kherson, one of the Ukrainian regions annexed by Russia, asked the Kremlin to organise evacuation. The request came after Ukrainian forces began counteroffensive in Kherson.

14.title: Mohammad Shami replaces Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad
14.article_body: The BCCI on Friday named fast bowler Mohammad Shami as Jasprit Bumrah's replacement in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad. Shami has reached Australia and will link up with the squad in Brisbane ahead of the warm-up matches, the BCCI said. Further, Mohammed Siraj and Shardul Thakur have been named as backups and will travel to Australia shortly.

15.title: Electric vehicle makers face penalty after probe into recent fire incidents
15.article_body: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has imposed a penalty on EV makers after an investigation into several two-wheelers catching fire, a report said. The government had formed high-level committee to review testing standards after at least 10 incidents of fire in EVs were reported between March and June. Penalty imposed under Central Motor Vehicles Rules has been collected.

16.title: 25-yr-old man climbs building via pipes, records girl taking bath in Goa; held
16.article_body: A 25-year-old man, Cipson Gomes, has been arrested for allegedly climbing on a building using pipes and recording a video of a girl while she was taking bath in Goa. Reports said that the video was taken when the girl was taking a bath in the washroom of a girls' hostel, reports added.

17.title: I-T Dept raids stores of garment retailer RS Brothers in Hyderabad
17.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Friday conducted searches at multiple stores and offices of garment and jewellery retailer RS Brothers. As per reports, raids were conducted over investments made by the company in the real estate business. Income Tax officials reportedly checked the transactions made by RS Brothers. They also searched the offices of some real estate firms.

18.title: Worked every day for 8 years, was depressed; developed health issues: Nargis
18.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri said that she worked every single day for eight years. "I hardly got to be with my family. I felt unwell due to stress. Consequently, I developed health issues. Was I depressed? I guess you can use the word. I was unhappy in my situation...I took two years off to get healthy," she added.

19.title: Thought I'll reach my peak at 24: 21-yr-old Swiatek after her 61st win in 2022
19.article_body: After her Tour-leading 61st win of the year, world number one Iga Swiatek said, "I wasn't expecting to have this kind of season this year." She added, "I thought, maybe, I'm going to be at my peak when I'm 24, 25." The 21-year-old's 61 wins are the most in a single season since Caroline Wozniacki's 60 in 2017.

20.title: US-based Bitcoin firm NYDIG lays off around 33% of its staff: Report
20.article_body: US-based Bitcoin company NYDIG laid off 110 employees, a third of its workforce, last month to cut costs, The Wall Street Journal reported. The company took the decision weeks before replacing its top two executives. Last year, NYDIG raised $1 billion in a funding round which increased the company's valuation to more than $7 billion.

21.title: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's security upgraded to 'Z+'
21.article_body: The Centre has upgraded the security of Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma from the 'Z' category cover to the 'Z+' category on an India basis. According to reports, the move comes after the security arrangement was reviewed by the Union Home Ministry. Sarma will be guarded by over 50 commandos whenever he travels within the country.

22.title: NCLT approves ArcelorMittal's ₹4,050-cr resolution plan for Uttam Galva
22.article_body: NCLT's Mumbai bench has reportedly approved the ₹4,050-crore resolution plan by ArcelorMittal's Indian arm for the debt-ridden Uttam Galva Steels. After Essar Steel and Odisha Slurry Pipeline Infrastructure, this is ArcelorMittal's third purchase through the insolvency process. NCLT had admitted an insolvency petition against Uttam Galva on SBI's plea in October 2020.

23.title: Infosys not to mandate return to office, flexible approach to continue: CEO
23.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh said the company has not mandated any fixed number of days that employees need to attend office physically and will continue with its flexible approach. "In our India offices, we have about 45,000 employees in the office at any given time...We are finding that the approach taken so far has been well received," Parekh said.

24.title: Govt to launch 5th Vande Bharat train on November 10: Reports
24.article_body: The fifth Vande Bharat Express train is likely to be launched on November 10 and would run on the Chennai-Bengaluru-Mysuru route. According to reports, the train will cover a total distance of 483 km. Earlier on Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi flagged off the fourth edition of Vande Bharat Express at the Amb Andaura railway station in Himachal Pradesh.

25.title: NGT imposes ₹500 cr fine on K'taka for failure to protect Chandapura lake
25.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed an environmental compensation fine of ₹500 crore on the Karnataka government for its failure in protecting Chandapura lake in Anekal taluka. "The state has failed to protect the environment...Lake ecology and ecosystem have hugely suffered. The state is thus, to be held liable to pay environmental compensation," NGT said.

26.title: We will not be intimidated by nuclear threats: NATO to Russia
26.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg on Thursday said the military alliance "will not be intimidated" by Russia's nuclear threats. "Russia's nuclear rhetoric is dangerous, reckless and they know that if they use [a] nuclear weapon against Ukraine, it will have severe consequences," he added. Stoltenberg also said that NATO will "very closely" monitor Russia's upcoming annual nuclear exercise.

27.title: 2 arrested in UP for objectionable remarks against Mulayam Singh
27.article_body: Two men have been arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district for allegedly making objectionable remarks on Facebook against Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, who passed away earlier this week. According to police, the accused compared Yadav to Ravana, the demon king in Ramayana. Both accused, Markandeya Swarnkar and Ajay Verma, are residents of Nagra, said police.

28.title: Pitbull dog attacks 11-year-old girl in Ghaziabad
28.article_body: A pitbull dog reportedly attacked an 11-year-old girl in Civitech Society in Ghaziabad on Wednesday. She was playing and taking a stroll along with her pets in the society when the dog bit her on both legs. Her family claimed negligence by the dog's owner as it was left out without a leash. The girl was taken to a hospital.

29.title: Rowdy sheeter arrested in Hyderabad; dummy pistol, dagger seized
29.article_body: The Hyderabad Detective Department Special Team (south) arrested a rowdy sheeter and seized a dagger and a dummy pistol from him. According to the police, 30-year-old Shaik Ahmed Bin Omar Bawazeer was absconding after a case was booked against him for outraging modesty of a woman. He was also allegedly involved in four cases, including two murder cases.

30.title: Bombay High Court acquits ex-DU professor GN Saibaba in UAPA case
30.article_body: Bombay High Court's Nagpur bench on Friday acquitted former Delhi University professor GN Saibaba in a UAPA case and ordered his immediate release from Nagpur Central Jail. The court also allowed the appeal of five other convicts in the case and acquitted them. Saibaba was convicted for alleged Maoist links in 2017 and sentenced to life imprisonment.

31.title: Mumbai gym trainer held for cheating woman of ₹13 lakh by promising visa
31.article_body: A 28-year-old gym trainer, who cheated a 30-year-old woman of ₹13 lakh by promising to get her a Canadian visa, has been arrested in Mumbai, police said. The complainant had hired the accused, Kiran Mandavkar, as her personal gym trainer two years ago, to whom she paid ₹13 lakh till November 2021. "We're...investigating if he cheated more persons," police said.

32.title: Pakistani senator arrested for tweeting against Army chief Bajwa
32.article_body: A senior member of ousted Pakistani PM Imran Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf has been arrested for a "highly obnoxious and intimidating" tweet against the country's Army chief, General Qamar Javed Bajwa. After a court acquitted PM Shehbaz Sharif and his son in a money laundering case on Wednesday, Senator Azam Swati congratulated Bajwa for "freeing criminals" and "legitimising corruption".

33.title: Talk of UK exit speculative, engaging with govt on subsidy: Tata Steel
33.article_body: Amid news reports of Tata Steel's exit from the UK market, CFO Koushik Chatterjee said the company is still actively engaging with the UK government regarding the subsidy issue and any talk of exit is speculative, Moneycontrol reported. Tata Steel UK has asked for £1.5 billion from British government for the transition to green energy, without which it might exit.

34.title: 1 lakh jobs, old pension scheme if we form govt in Himachal: Priyanka
34.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday promised one lakh government jobs and implementation of the old pension scheme if the party is voted to power in the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Addressing a rally in Solan, Gandhi said, "BJP doesn't have money for pension but can waive off loans of their big businessmen."

35.title: PMC, NHAI form teams to stop dumping of garbage around highways
35.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) have formed vigilance teams in a joint operation to stop the dumping of garbage around highways and service roads. "Our teams...filed 94 cases so far and collected ₹65,490 in fines," PMC Deputy Commissioner (Solid Waste Management Department) Asha Raut said. The PMC also urged people to not dump waste.

36.title: WPI inflation falls to 10.7% in Sept, in double digits for 18 straight months
36.article_body: India's wholesale price index (WPI)-based inflation eased to 10.7% in September, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry data showed. WPI remained in the double digits for the 18th consecutive month beginning April 2021. WPI inflation surged to 12.41% during August, while it was revised to 14.07% from 13.93% for July, the data showed. WPI inflation in September 2021 was 11.80%.

37.title: Ekta Kapoor's Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Khan missing in Kenya since July
37.article_body: Ekta Kapoor's Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Khan has been missing in Nairobi, Kenya, since July this year. The 48-year-old went on holiday and was due to return on July 24. However, he dropped out of contact on July 21. The family has written to the government to trace him and also started an online campaign #BringZulfiBack.

38.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till Oct 18, list released
38.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs. It  is very likely over Andaman & Nicobar Islands, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Kerala from October 15 to 18. Further, Telangana may witness it on October 15 and Karnataka may witness it from October 15 to 17. Lakshadweep may witness it on October 18.

39.title: Hindu Sena files PIL in Delhi HC against Om Raut's 'Adipurush'
39.article_body: A PIL has been filed in Delhi HC against Om Raut's upcoming movie 'Adipurush', seeking removal of 'objectionable content' related to Lord Ram, Hanuman, Raavan and others. The plea has been moved by National President of Hindu Sena, Vishnu Gupta. It states that the movie has hurt the sentiments of Hindu community by depicting religious figures in an inappropriate manner.

40.title: Video of 'idli ATM' vending idlis 24×7 in Bengaluru goes viral
40.article_body: A video of an 'idli ATM' vending idlis 24×7 in Bengaluru has gone viral on social media. The automated idli-making machine, which is set up by Bengaluru-based startup Freshot Robotics, can reportedly prepare and dispense 72 packaged idlis and chutney in 12 minutes. The video showed a customer scanning the QR code placed near the ATM to place her order.

41.title: Indian Army dog ‘Zoom’ passes away, officers lay wreath on mortal remains
41.article_body: Indian Army assault dog 'Zoom' passed away on Thursday. Army officers on Friday laid a wreath on the mortal remains of the assault dog 'Zoom'. The army canine passed away while he was under treatment after he was shot twice during an operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag, reports said.

42.title: Himachal Pradesh Assembly poll dates released, voting on November 12
42.article_body: Voting for Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh will take place in one phase on November 12, the Election Commission of India (ECI) said on Friday. Counting of votes will be held on December 8, it said, adding that the last date for nominations is October 25. Dates for the Gujarat Assembly elections were not announced on Friday.

43.title: I would never write off WI, something special will happen in Aus: Sammy
43.article_body: Ex-West Indies skipper Daren Sammy said that he would never write off the Caribbean team in a tournament and feels something special will happen in the T20 World Cup in Australia. "Kyle Mayers is such a talent...and we know Nicholas [Pooran] is a match-winner. The good thing this time round is we have bowlers who can take wickets," Sammy said.

44.title: Workers beat BJP corporator's husband in MP police station; video surfaces
44.article_body: A video of sanitation workers and their relatives purportedly beating a BJP corporator's husband at a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Indore has surfaced online. The incident occurred when the corporator's husband was called to the police station after the workers came to file a complaint against him for allegedly abusing a female worker over the phone.

45.title: It doesn't bother me: Sidharth on wedding rumours with Kiara
45.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, when asked if the rumours about his wedding with actress Kiara Advani bother him, said, "No, it doesn't." He added he doesn't think there's anything to be bothered about after being in the film industry for 10 years. Sidharth further said if he was getting married, it would be very difficult to keep it a secret today.

46.title: Man enters house in Bihar's Bettiah and opens fire, 4 injured
46.article_body: A man entered a house in Bihar's Bettiah and opened fire injuring four persons on Thursday, police said. "One man entered a house and shot four people in the Jogapatti Police Station area. The accused was nabbed with the help of villagers," police added. A bullet hit the throat of one of the victims and he has been hospitalised.

47.title: I'd like to see Australia, India, Pakistan in T20 WC semi-finals: Akram
47.article_body: Ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram backed India, Pakistan and Australia to play in the semi-finals of the tournament in Australia. "But South Africa could be a dark horse," said Akram. India failed to reach the knockout stage in the 2021 edition. Australia are the defending champions. World Cup will begin on Sunday.

48.title: Infosys let go of employees working for two companies in last 12 months: CEO
48.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh has revealed that the company let go of employees who were found to be working at two specific companies in the last 12 months. The fired employees were working for companies where there were issues regarding confidentiality, Parekh added. Last month, Wipro fired around 300 employees who were working directly for the IT company's competitors.

49.title: BJP leader urinates on district president's banner in MP; expelled as video goes viral
49.article_body: A video showing BJP leader Shailendra Bhadauria urinating on party's district president Devendra Singh Narwaria in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind has gone viral on social media. BJP has expelled Bhadauria from the primary membership of the party for 6 years. BJP State General Secretary Bhagwandas Sabnani said that the act is highly indecent and condemnable, which the party will never tolerate.

50.title: Only 2 Indian startups turned unicorn in Q3 amid slow funding: PwC
50.article_body: Shiprocket and OneCard are the only two Indian startups to turn unicorn in Q3 2022 amid slowdown in funding, PwC India reported. The July-September period produced 20 unicorns globally and 45% of them were from SaaS segment. "The global slowdown in funding continues with startup funding in India in Q3 CY22 hitting two-year low at $2.7 billion," the report added.

51.title: Senior citizen, son hacked to death at home in Hyderabad
51.article_body: A man aged about 75 years and his son were reportedly hacked to death at their home by two unidentified assailants in Hyderabad's Uppal on Friday morning. The son, who was about 40 years old, had recently returned from Malaysia. According to a police officer, differences between family members due to property disputes could have led to the murder.

52.title: 17 K'taka forest officials booked for custodial death of tribal man
52.article_body: As many as 17 officials of Karnataka Forest Department have been booked over the custodial death of a tribal man in Mysuru, said police. The suspects took the victim, 41-year-old Kariyappa, into illegal custody accusing him of killing a deer in the reserve forest, added police. The victim was allegedly assaulted and later taken to a hospital, where he died.

53.title: Chhath Puja to be celebrated at 1,100 places in Delhi; ₹25 crore allocated
53.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal announced that the government would organise Chhath Puja at 1,100 places this year and has also allocated ₹25 crore for the festival. The amount will be used for arrangements like power backup, ambulances, washrooms, etc. The CM said that the government is making all efforts to ensure that devotees celebrate on a grand scale.

54.title: Winner of India-Pak match will reach T20 WC 2022 semis: Aakash Chopra
54.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said the team emerging victorious in the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Pakistan on October 23, will reach the semi-finals of the tournament. "We say that Pakistan drop so many catches but the fact is that we drop more catches than them," Aakash had earlier stated while discussing Team India's fielding.

55.title: 'Radicalised teenager' kills 2 people outside gay bar in Slovakia
55.article_body: A "radicalised teenager" shot dead two people outside a gay bar in Slovakia's capital Bratislava on Wednesday evening, PM Eduard Heger said. "No form of white supremacy, racism and extremism against communities, including LGBTI, can be tolerated...We will fight disinformation channels spreading hate and protect minorities," Heger added. The suspected gunman was found dead on Thursday, police said.

56.title: SAT stays SEBI's shut down order against Brickwork Ratings: Report
56.article_body: The Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) has reportedly put a stay on SEBI's decision ordering Brickwork Ratings India to wind up operations within six months. The final hearing of the case will be held on November 15. SEBI had instructed Brickwork to not take on fresh clients for "failure to exercise proper skill, care and diligence...duties as a credit rating agency".

57.title: Govt not running Zomato, collect your aid: UP DM to flood-hit people
57.article_body: In a viral video, UP's Ambedkar Nagar District Magistrate Samuel Paul N was seen telling flood-hit people to collect relief material themselves as "the government is not running Zomato" to provide door-to-door service. "You will be provided with chlorine tablets, and a doctor will come to see when one falls sick. This is why flood posts are established," he said.

58.title: India picked too many spinners for WC, Umran should've been taken: Arun
58.article_body: Ex-Team India bowling coach Bharat Arun said Team India have picked "far too many" spinners for the T20 World Cup 2022, adding that selecting pacer Umran Malik instead of one spinner would've been "very wise". "There's bounce, the grounds are big...Umran is exciting, he's got the pace...and given the right kind of fields he's done...well in the IPL," he stated.

59.title: No scientific probe of 'Shivling' inside Gyanvapi Mosque as UP court rejects plea
59.article_body: A Varanasi court on Friday rejected the plea of Hindu worshippers to conduct a scientific probe into the contested structure inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. The plea has been rejected in view of the Supreme Court order to seal the alleged Shivling that was found during the court-mandated videography of the premises. Court arguments in the matter concluded last week.

60.title: Layoffs will be the absolute last thing at Zoho, it destroys loyalty: CEO
60.article_body: Software startup Zoho's CEO Sridhar Vembu said that layoffs will be the "absolute last thing" that the company will ever consider. "It kind of destroys loyalty...If we want our employees to be loyal, we have to be loyal to them," the billionaire explained. Vembu further said that even when the times are tough, the company needs to retain its talent.

61.title: 10 houses develop cracks during work at metro tunnel in Kolkata
61.article_body: At least 10 houses in Kolkata's Bowbazar developed cracks due to water seepage during work at the East-West Metro tunnel on Friday. Residents of these houses have been shifted to nearby hotels, Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation General Manager (Administration and HR) AK Nandy said. The buildings in Bowbazar had developed cracks due to metro work in May also.

62.title: SpaceX says it cannot fund Starlink in Ukraine, seeks funding from US govt
62.article_body: SpaceX, in a letter to the Pentagon, said that it can no longer donate or fund Starlink terminals for Ukraine. The Elon Musk-led company has requested the US government to take over funding for Ukraine's government and military use of Starlink. SpaceX estimates that providing Starlink in Ukraine will cost more than $120 million for the rest of the year.

63.title: Musk is under federal probe over his conduct in $44 billion deal, says Twitter
63.article_body: Twitter has claimed that the world's richest person Elon Musk is being investigated by federal authorities over his conduct in his $44-billion takeover deal. Attorneys for the Tesla CEO claimed "investigative privilege" when refusing to hand over documents, Twitter said in a court filing. "This game of 'hide the ball' must end," the company, which sued Musk in July, added.

64.title: 3 employees of investment firm booked for cheating senior citizen in Thane
64.article_body: Three employees of an investment firm were booked for allegedly cheating a senior citizen of more than ₹75 lakh in Thane, Maharashtra. The 69-year-old victim alleged that the accused wooed him to invest on the promise of lucrative returns, which he never got, police said. The accused were the public relations officer, regional manager and head manager of the firm.

65.title: 'Kantara' beats 'KGF 2', becomes highest rated Indian film on IMDb
65.article_body: Kannada film 'Kantara', starring Rishab Shetty, has become the highest-rated Indian film on IMDb, surpassing 'KGF Chapter 2'. 'Kantara' currently has a rating of 9.5 on IMDb, followed by 'KGF Chapter 2' (8.4) and SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' (8). Directed by Rishab Shetty, 'Kantara' deals with the issues of land and ownership.

66.title: Taxi driver arrested for stalking & harassing 3 schoolgirls in Mumbai
66.article_body: Police have arrested a 35-year-old taxi driver for allegedly harassing and stalking three schoolgirls in Mumbai's Colaba. Teachers of a municipal school approached the police on Wednesday, alleging that the accused had been making objectionable gestures at the girls for the last three to four days. The court has sent him to judicial custody for 14 days.

67.title: Look to score vs Shaheen, don't just survive: Gambhir to India batters
67.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Team India's batters should look to score runs against Pakistan's Shaheen Afridi rather than simply looking to survive, when the teams face off in the T20 World Cup 2022 on October 23. "The moment you look to survive, everything becomes really small...Team India [have] got...quality batters in their top...four who can definitely take on Shaheen," added Gambhir.

68.title: T'gana CM KCR busy with his political agenda: BJP's Ponguleti Sudhakar
68.article_body: BJP leader Ponguleti Sudhakar Reddy criticised the TRS government for luring voters despite heavy rains in parts of Telangana. He also accused CM KCR of being busy with his political agenda. "The ministers are busy luring voters in Munugode. Is this governance? Is this the Telangana model? This government is not for the common man," said Sudhakar.

69.title: Greater Noida Police arrest two for assaulting 59-year-old man
69.article_body: The Greater Noida Police arrested two staff members of a society for allegedly thrashing a 59-year-old man. The victim, Pratap Singh, has sustained injuries on his head and back. "The plumber and electrician of the society got into an argument with the victim, which turned violent and the victim was allegedly beaten with sticks by the suspects," said the police.

70.title: Can't operate without Gandhis, have to take their guidance: Kharge
70.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge, who will be contesting the party's Presidential election, told Indian Express during an interview that "without the Gandhis, you can't (operate)…you have to take their guidance". Kharge said this on being asked about how a "non-Gandhi presidency" would work. "[Gandhi's] have sacrificed for this country. Even the positions (they have taken)," he further said.

71.title: Chivas Regal maker's India head steps down due to health reasons
71.article_body: Chivas Regal maker Pernod Ricard's India head, Thibault Cuny, has stepped down from his role due to health reasons, the French spirits giant said. The company said Cuny will take a break from his professional duties but will stay on with Pernod. Cuny took over as the Managing Director and CEO of Pernod Ricard South Asia in 2019.

72.title: NASA shares pic of dust 'fingerprint' created by 2 stars that meet once every 8 years
72.article_body: NASA has released a picture of "fingerprint-like pattern" formed by two giant stars that come together about once every eight years. The image, captured by James Webb Space Telescope, shows at least 17 concentric dust rings. Each ring was created when the two stars came close together and their stellar winds met, compressing the gas and forming dust, NASA said.

73.title: US-based 6sense fires 150 workers globally, including India: Report
73.article_body: US-based AI firm 6sense has fired close to 150 employees globally, including India, citing uncertain macroeconomic conditions, Moneycontrol reported. The layoffs happened across teams including content, design, sales and marketing. Employees were reportedly offered to encash privilege leaves as part of severance package. The Tiger Global-backed company is currently valued at $5.2 billion.

74.title: S Korea scrambles jets as 10 N Korean military aircraft fly close to border
74.article_body: South Korea scrambled fighter jets after 10 North Korean military aircraft flew close to the border dividing two countries, South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a statement. The North Korean aircraft were flying 25 km north of the Military Demarcation Line. The statement added that South Korean air force conducted an emergency sortie and maintained a response posture.

75.title: Expected justice, not verdict from SC: Student expelled over hijab
75.article_body: Udupi student Aliya Assadi, who was expelled for wearing hijab, said she was expecting justice from the Supreme Court, not the split verdict that came. Assadi was among the first to challenge the hijab ban in Karnataka High Court. Assadi appreciated Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia's remarks saying it "represented our struggle, allowing us to get our education with our constitutional values".

76.title: Prithvi Shaw smashes highest T20 score by an Indian in 2022
76.article_body: Mumbai opener Prithvi Shaw on Friday smashed the highest T20 score by an Indian in 2022. The 22-year-old slammed 134(61), including 13 fours and nine sixes, against Assam in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. The previous highest T20 score by an Indian in 2022 was registered by Karnataka opener Devdutt Padikkal, who slammed 124*(62) against Maharashtra on Tuesday.

77.title: Young boy sits on pilot's seat, holds control wheel of moving plane in Guj; video viral
77.article_body: A video showing a young boy sitting on a pilot's seat and holding the control wheel of a moving aircraft reportedly at Surat airport in Gujarat is going viral online. The aircraft, which is believed to be a single-engine plane, can be seen moving on a runway while the boy takes instructions from the pilot sitting next to him.

78.title: At least 11 killed, dozens injured in bus explosion in Mali
78.article_body: At least 11 people were killed and dozens were injured in an explosion on a bus in central Mali on Thursday, according to a hospital source. The bus hit an explosive device while travelling the road between Bandiagara and Goundaka, in the Mopti area, known as a hotbed for jihadist violence. Mali has been fighting Islamist insurgency since 2012.

79.title: 2 more minors file POCSO case against rape-accused seer Shivamurthy Murugha
79.article_body: Karnataka Police registered a POCSO case against seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, Sri Murugha Mutt's chief pontiff, as two more minors have accused him of rape and sexual assault. Police have registered an FIR against seven people. The seer was earlier arrested after two minors, studying and staying at the Mutt's hostel in Chitradurga, accused him of rape and sexual assault.

80.title: Doctor removes 23 contact lenses from woman's eye who 'forgot' to take them off in US
80.article_body: A doctor in US' California removed 23 contact lenses from an eye of a patient and shared a video of the procedure on Instagram. "A rare occasion when someone 'forgot' to remove contact lenses at night and kept on putting a new one in every morning. 23 days in a row," the doctor wrote in her post.

81.title: UP minister's nephew held for trying to ram car into restaurant staff
81.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Arun Kumar's nephew who allegedly tried to ram his car into a group of restaurant workers in Bareilly has been arrested, police said on Friday. The incident occurred after the restaurant staff apparently refused to serve the accused. "The police must act as per the law, and there should be no laxity on this," Kumar told PTI.

82.title: Infosys shares surge 5% after Q2 results, ₹9,300-cr buyback news
82.article_body: A day after Infosys reported an 11.1% year-on-year surge in quarterly net profit at ₹6,021 crore, its shares rose by 5% on Friday. At 11:10 am, Infosys' stock was trading 5.11% higher at ₹ 1,492.30 apiece on the BSE. Its revenue from operations surged 23.4% to ₹36,538 crore. Infosys will also buy back shares worth ₹9,300 crore to reward shareholders.

83.title: BJP leader fined ₹800 for defying govt order after Akhlaq lynching
83.article_body: A fine of ₹800 has been imposed on BJP leader Sangeet Som after he was found guilty of violating the government's order in Uttar Pradesh's Bisahda village following Mohammad Akhlaq's lynching in 2015. Som had reportedly addressed a crowd of over hundreds of people in the wake of Akhlaq's death while CrPC Section 144 was in place in the area.

84.title: Turkish MP smashes phone with hammer in Parliament to protest new media bill
84.article_body: A Turkish lawmaker smashed his mobile phone with a hammer while speaking in Parliament. Burak Erbay, a member of the opposition Republican People's Party, was protesting against a proposed government-backed bill that aims to combat online "disinformation". As per the legislation, journalists and social media users could be jailed for up to three years for spreading fake news.

85.title: Lifestyle's new campaign aims to inspire customers to groove in style
85.article_body: Lifestyle announced the launch of its festive campaign that aims to encourage fashion lovers to elevate their style with the brand's new collection ahead of the seasonal celebrations. Shoppers will get a Portico bedsheet worth ₹2,499 for ₹799* on minimum shopping of ₹5,000 along with 10% cashback with HDFC cards on shopping worth ₹7,500*.

86.title: World's first space tourist Dennis Tito, his wife buy tickets to fly around Moon
86.article_body: Dennis Tito, who became the world's first-ever space tourist in 2001, and his wife Akiko have purchased two tickets on SpaceX's Starship rocket to fly around the Moon on a week-long mission. The couple paid an undisclosed amount and will travel with 10 other passengers. At 82, Tito could become the oldest person to go into orbit and deep space.

87.title: Superspreader of lies: Jairam after Shah blames Nehru for J&K issue
87.article_body: After Union Minister Amit Shah blamed former PM Jawaharlal Nehru's "mistake" of inserting Article 370 for the "mess" in Jammu and Kashmir, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said, "Nehru didn't dictatorially insert Article 370...It was discussed, unlike notebandi (demonetisation)." He added that Shah is "as much a superspreader of lies as his Saheb". "Nobody resigned over it," he further said.

88.title: Man stabs wife to death over daughter's disobedience in Ghaziabad
88.article_body: A case was filed after a man allegedly stabbed his wife to death after getting infuriated over his daughter's disobedience in Ghaziabad's Masuri, police said on Thursday. The man had asked his daughter to get a bedsheet but she didn't as she was playing, Additional SP (Rural) Iraj Raja said. The wife succumbed to her injuries during treatment, Raja added.

89.title: Dera chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh granted 40-day parole
89.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh has been granted parole for 40 days. He is currently serving prison sentence in Haryana's Sunaria jail. The move has come ahead of upcoming Adampur bypolls. He had earlier come out of prison in February and June. He is serving a 20-year jail term for raping two women in his Sirsa ashram.

90.title: Iraqi Parliament elects Abdul Latif Rashid as new President
90.article_body: Lawmakers in Iraq on Thursday elected Abdul Latif Rashid as the country's new President, paving the way for the formation of a new government and ending a year of deadlock after October 2021 election. Soon after being elected, Rashid named Mohamed Shia al-Sudani as PM. Thursday's vote took place shortly after at least nine rockets landed around Baghdad's Green Zone.

91.title: Meta seeks dismissal of US FTC lawsuit over VR company acquisition
91.article_body: Meta on Thursday asked a federal court to dismiss a lawsuit filed by the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) against its proposed acquisition of California-based VR firm Within Unlimited and its fitness app Supernatural. The lawsuit, filed in July, said the deal would hurt competition in VR fitness market. Meta said the lawsuit is "ill-conceived" and "relies on pure speculation".

92.title: AAP has an old habit of doing drama: CT Ravi on Gopal Italia's remark
92.article_body: Reacting to AAP leader Gopal Italia's recent remark against temples, BJP leader CT Ravi criticised the party and said that the AAP has an old habit of doing drama. "The people of Gujarat are intelligent, they know that AAP is doing drama...The Gujaratis have always been with PM Modi and they will be in the future also," said Ravi.

93.title: Karnataka-proposed EV hub to house 1,000 startups: Ashwath Narayan
93.article_body: Karnataka government's proposed EV industry hub will house about 1,000 startups, Minister of Information Technology and Biotechnology, CN Ashwath Narayan said. While addressing a conference, Narayan said five centres will be set up to facilitate training, research, development, innovation and entrepreneurship. The state will become a premier hub of EVs in a couple of years, he added.

94.title: Meta's Product Design VP Margaret Stewart to leave after 10 years
94.article_body: Meta's VP of Product Design Margaret Stewart will leave the company after over 10 years. Notably, Stewart also led Meta's now-dissolved Responsible Innovation team that focused on identifying potential harms of the firm's products. Announcing her departure, Stewart said she was "sad" that the team was reorganised but remains hopeful that its work will "continue to influence" what Meta builds.

95.title: US interest rates may go over 4.5% to tame inflation: JPMorgan CEO
95.article_body: America's largest bank JPMorgan Chase's CEO Jamie Dimon warned that US policymakers might have to increase interest rates to more than 4.5% to tame inflation amid a looming recession. Dimon said quantitative tightening and fragile energy supply could lead to an uncertain future. "It's bad...those things are huge turbulence...that can easily cause a recession," Dimon further said.

96.title: India's 5G is indigenous and can be provided to other nations: FM
96.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the 5G technology in India is completely indigenous except for some "critical parts" that have been imported. "There could be some critical parts coming from, say, countries like (South) Korea, but certainly not from somebody else. So complete indigenous technology that we can now provide 5G (to any country) who wants it," Sitharaman said.

97.title: Teen girl who worked in Bengaluru dies after getting molested in bus
97.article_body: A 19-year-old girl, who started her first job only two months ago in Bengaluru, died after getting molested in a moving bus while travelling to her hometown Belagavi, said police. She had bite marks on her lips and neck, along with cigarette burns and head injuries, an officer said. "She was assaulted, but she was not raped," said Belagavi ACP.

98.title: Asian govts spent $50 bn forex reserves in Sept amid rising dollar: Report
98.article_body: Asian governments spent about $50 billion in foreign exchange reserves in September, which is the highest since March 2020, amid surging US dollar, according to Exante Data Inc. Emerging Asian countries, excluding China, spent nearly $30 billion in dollar sales in the spot market in September, while the figure rose to $50 billion with the inclusion of Japan, Exante said.

99.title: Iftikhar plays like MS Dhoni but can't finish like Dhoni did: Ajmal
99.article_body: Former Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal said Pakistan batter Iftikhar Ahmad bats like MS Dhoni but cannot finish like Dhoni used to. "Dhoni used to take singles and hit sixes towards the end to compensate...Iftikhar plays 10 dot balls...and when...[he tries] to recover by hitting big shots...[he gets] out," added Ajmal. "Where do you stand?" he stated.

100.title: ED raids 25 locations in national capital in Delhi excise policy case
100.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday raided about 25 locations in the national capital as part of its money laundering case investigation in connection with the now-scrapped Delhi excise policy. The locations raided belong to private entities linked to liquor dealerships and distributorships, officials said. Earlier, ED raided about 35 locations in Delhi and Punjab in connection with the case.

101.title: Over 600 Russia-annexed settlements liberated in past month: Ukraine
101.article_body: Ukrainian soldiers have liberated more than 600 Russia-occupied settlements, including 75 in Kherson region, in the past month, Ukraine's Ministry for Reintegration of the Temporary Occupied Territories said. More than 500 settlements were liberated in Kharkiv, 43 in Donetsk and seven in Luhansk. Russia recently annexed four Ukrainian regions including Kherson, Donetsk, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia.

102.title: Ammunition depot near border destroyed in Ukraine strikes: Russia
102.article_body: The governor of a Russian border region, Belgorod, has accused Ukraine of shelling an apartment building and blowing up an ammunition depot. No one was hurt in the attacks, Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov added. Meanwhile, Ukraine has denied Moscow's claim and said Russia had launched a missile toward Ukraine's Kharkiv city but "something went wrong and it hit [the] residential building".

103.title: Pune man arrested for vehicle thefts, 16 stolen two-wheelers seized
103.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 26-year-old man for allegedly committing vehicle thefts and recovered 16 stolen two-wheelers from him. About 200 CCTV cameras were checked and police got clues that led them to the accused, a press release stated. Police laid a trap and nabbed the man at the red light area in Budhwar Peth's Dane Ali.

104.title: Audience blasted with weed smoke from fog machine during rapper's performance in US
104.article_body: Audience at Kushstock Festival in US' California was recently blasted with weed smoke from fog machines during rapper Chucky Chuck's performance. A video shared by the rapper shows smoke coming out of the two cannabis cannons operated by a man on the stage while Chuck performs. The crowd can be heard cheering.

105.title: Development of K'taka took a back seat due to Cong's rule: Bommai
105.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress and said that the development of the state took a back seat due to Congress' 50 years of rule. "The Congress party has been doing Bharat Jodo Yatra...They cannot even implement pro-people policies but have indulged in power politics...The people will permanently send them back home in 2023," said Bommai.

106.title: TMC wants to remove Hindus from certain areas of Kolkata: Suvendu Adhikari
106.article_body: Talking about the Mominpur violence, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari criticised the ruling TMC and alleged that the party wants to remove Hindus from certain areas of Kolkata. "This is CM Mamata Banerjee's vote bank politics. The Hindu vote is going towards the BJP and CM Banerjee is taking minority votes by threatening and doing communal campaigns," said Adhikari.

107.title: 2 on way to celebrate birthday killed in car accident in Mumbai, 7 injured
107.article_body: Two boys, aged 26 and 18, died in a car accident while they were on their way to celebrate someone's birthday. Seven others were also injured in the incident. One of the boys said that the car's tyre burst while they were on their way, following which, the driver lost control of the vehicle.

108.title: Beauty contest poster offers winner chance to marry NRI; Punjab police shares post
108.article_body: Posters of a beauty contest advertising that the winning girl will be given a chance to marry a Canadian NRI have been put up in Punjab's Bathinda. Sharing the poster, Bathinda Police tweeted, "Taking Swift action Bathinda Police registered FIR & action is being taken against the guilty persons. Violation of law will not be tolerated at any cost."

109.title: No jeans, T-shirts in class: Muzaffarnagar official warns teachers
109.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar administration has issued a circular warning teachers of all government schools and colleges against wearing jeans and T-shirts in classrooms as it may give a "wrong impression" to students. "It is a matter of discipline," said District Inspector of Schools (DIOS) Gajendra Kumar Singh. Female teachers need to wear saree or salwar-kameez, he added.

110.title: Snap employee data exposed after breach at a document firm: Report
110.article_body: Messaging app Snap has reported that its employees' data was exposed by a breach at a third-party document analysis firm, Elevate, Reuters reported. Elevate reportedly told Snap that an unauthorised party had accessed some of its computer systems in March 2022. According to a letter to a former employee, information including name, address and employment history may have been affected.

111.title: Uttarakhand BJP MLA apologises for 'patao goddesses' remark
111.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP MLA Bansidhar Bhagat on Thursday apologised for his 'patao goddesses' remark that he made on the International Day of the Girl Child earlier this week. "My intentions were pure. By saying 'patao', I just meant coaxing the goddesses for their blessings. Still, if my words have hurt anyone, I take them back," he said.

112.title: Spain newspaper uses snake charmer cartoon for India, Zerodha CEO calls it 'an insult'
112.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has criticised a Spanish newspaper for using the caricature of a snake charmer to represent India. He shared a picture of La Vanguardia's front page on Twitter, which showed the caricature with the headline, "The Hour of the Indian Economy". Kamath said, "Quite cool that the world is taking notice, but the cultural caricaturing...is an insult."

113.title: Duo who cheated 600 to 700 people on pretext of jobs held in Noida
113.article_body: Two men who were operating from an office in Noida were arrested for allegedly cheating 600 to 700 people by forging fake passports, visas and tickets for them under the pretext of providing them jobs in the Gulf area. The accused's modus operandi was to set up a fake company and then collect ₹65,000 to ₹1 lakh from the applicants.

114.title: Tiger allegedly seen at Pune's Sinhagad Fort; forest dept on alert
114.article_body: A couple claimed on Thursday that they spotted a tiger at Pune's Sinhagad Fort. Deputy Conservator of Forests (Territorial) Pune Rahul Patil said that the forest department is verifying the claim. A police inspector said that a team was rushed to the spot after being informed about the claim and people in the vicinity were warned as a precautionary measure.

115.title: Probe started, will investigate all rumours: Police on Kerala human sacrifice
115.article_body: Kochi Deputy Commissioner of Police S Sasidharan has said that the investigation into the Kerala human sacrifice case has started and that all rumours will be probed. "It is progressing. We will decide on evidence collection soon. We haven't decided the date and time of evidence collection," he added. Police said that the accused allegedly lured victims with money.

116.title: 3-year-old boy found with grandmother's body in Ghaziabad's Modinagar
116.article_body: A three-year-old boy was found with his 58-year-old grandmother's body in Ghaziabad's Modinagar on Thursday, police said. Prima facie, she appeared to have suffered a head injury, police added. "When I reached my mother's house to pick up my son...I found her dead with injuries on the head...my son crying by the side of her body," the deceased's son said.

117.title: India reports 2,678 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,583
117.article_body: India reported 2,678 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,786 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,583. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,857 following 10 casualties in the last 24 hours.

118.title: Apple ordered to sell iPhones with charger by Brazil court, fined ₹156 crore
118.article_body: A Brazilian court on Thursday fined Apple 100 million reais (around ₹156 crore) and ruled that battery chargers must come with new iPhones sold in the country. The lawsuit filed by an association of borrowers, consumers and taxpayers argued that the company commits abusive practices by selling its flagship product without a charger. Apple said it will appeal the decision.

119.title: Bandhan Bank onboards Sourav Ganguly as brand ambassador
119.article_body: Bandhan Bank has announced Sourav Ganguly as its brand ambassador. Fondly called 'Dada' and 'Maharaja of Indian Cricket', Sourav Ganguly will be the voice of Bandhan Bank, helping the brand take its message to the masses. "This association is another step towards connecting strongly with consumers across the spectrum and reinforcing our ongoing mission of inclusive banking," the brand stated.

120.title: Set your house in order instead of lecturing: India after Pak raises Kashmir issue
120.article_body: After Pakistan accused India of committing atrocities in Jammu and Kashmir at the CICA summit in Astana, MoS for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi said, "Pakistan's remarks...constitute gross interference in India's internal affairs." She added, "With its own record of...dismal treatment of minority communities, Pakistan would be well advised to set its house in order instead of lecturing."

121.title: Turkey introduces jail terms for 'disinformation'
121.article_body: Turkish Parliament has passed a new media bill that could see reporters and social media users jailed for up to three years for spreading "disinformation". The Council of Europe said the new measure's vague definition of "disinformation" and the accompanying threat of jail could have a "chilling effect and increased self-censorship, not least in view of the upcoming elections in...2023".

122.title: 'I'll f*** you right here,' Pak minister's aide yells at man calling leader 'chor' in US
122.article_body: Pakistani minister Ishaq Dar was heckled by protestors at an airport in US' Washington DC, following which his aide was seen abusing a man calling Dar a 'chor' (thief). "I'll f*** you right here, motherf*****. You don't know me," the aide could be seen yelling at the protestor. Dar was in US to attend IMF and World Bank's meetings.

123.title: JPMorgan cuts ties with Kanye, gives him until Nov 21 to move assets
123.article_body: JPMorgan Chase has cut ties with Kanye West, officially known as Ye, and has given him until November 21 to transfer his business to another bank. A letter apparently sent by the bank to the rapper was shared by conservative activist Candace Owens. The bank reportedly sent the letter in September, weeks before Kanye received criticism over his anti-Semitic comments.

124.title: T'gana court acquits all 24 accused in connection with 2008 communal riots
124.article_body: A Telangana court has acquitted all the 24 accused in connection with the communal riots that broke out in Nirmal district's Bhainsa town in 2008. The prosecution had failed to furnish proper evidence to prove the charges, the court said. Notably, all the 24 accused were released on bail within three months of the incident.

125.title: Bengaluru Police seizes 1,580 kg red sandalwood, arrests 5
125.article_body: Bengaluru's Mahalakshmi Layout Police carried out raids at three places and seized 1,580 kilograms of red sandalwood, said police. Five suspects have been arrested and further investigation is underway, added police. Last month, Bengaluru Police had busted an inter-state gang and recovered 730 kilograms of sandalwood and 147 litres of sandalwood oil.

126.title: Work on Gurugram's Dhanwapur underpass to be completed soon: Dy CM
126.article_body: Haryana Deputy Chief Minister Dushyant Chautala confirmed that the Dhanwapur underpass project will be completed soon and that he will personally monitor the project's progress. The railway underpass is being developed in Gurugram's Sector 104, which will connect the old city with new sectors along the Dwarka Expressway. He further added that the expressway would be completed by next year.

127.title: One will rarely claim that Hardik can be T20 WC's top run-scorer: Nehra
127.article_body: Discussing the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said, "You will rarely see anyone claim that Dinesh Karthik or Hardik Pandya will finish as the tournament's leading run-getter because they'll face fewer deliveries." "Whoever bats at the top will...be among the runs," added Nehra. India will face Pakistan in their first match of T20 World Cup 2022.

128.title: 111 sentenced for drunk driving in Hyd, ₹2.36 lakh fine imposed
128.article_body: As many as 111 persons accused of drunk driving were produced before courts in Hyderabad on Wednesday. Five of them were sentenced to two days of imprisonment, while two were asked to do community service for two days. A collective fine of ₹2.36 lakh was imposed on the remaining 104 persons.

129.title: Pakistani drone allegedly carrying consignment shot down in Punjab
129.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Friday shot down a drone that entered India from Pakistan at the International Border in Punjab's Gurdaspur. It is suspected that the drone was carrying a consignment and a massive search operation has been launched in the area to determine the same. Gurdaspur BSF DIG said that the soldiers fired 17 rounds of bullets.

130.title: Watchman arrested for sexually assaulting 11-year-old in Mumbai
130.article_body: A 58-year-old watchman has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting an 11-year-old girl in south Mumbai. The incident took place when the minor girl was at her aunt’s place after the school. The accused allegedly sexually assaulted her behind a cab. A case has been filed in accordance with the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and POCSO Act.

131.title: Honda says it goes 'beyond' for its customers in its latest ad campaign
131.article_body: Aiming to celebrate its bond with its customers, Honda Cars India launched its new brand campaign 'A Honda Goes Beyond'. HCIL President and CEO, Takuya Tsumura, said credit goes to customers who bestowed their trust in Honda for the last 25 years and that it has been Honda's endeavour to keep customers at the centre of their products and services.

132.title: Kerala human sacrifice accused shared FB post on 'blacksmith's wife' after women's murder
132.article_body: Bhagaval Singh, one of the three persons accused of torturing and killing two women as 'human sacrifice' in Kerala, wrote a poem in his Facebook post days after the second woman's murder. "A furnace, blacksmith's wife at work, her body bent over," he wrote in Malayalam. Singh allegedly met Mohammed Shafi, the prime accused in the case, on Facebook.

133.title: Was told I did 'Soch', 'Joker' for sympathy; couldn't sing for 1.5 yrs: Harrdy
133.article_body: Singer Harrdy Sandhu said that he got messages saying that he does songs like 'Soch', 'Joker' and 'Naa Ji Naa' to gain sympathy. "I took it to my heart, I couldn't sing any song for 1.5 years. Then I picked myself up...and then I started singing and I started doing dance numbers...When they also worked...then I was happy," he added.

134.title: Even British didn't tax food: Kejriwal on Guj body's 18% GST on parantha order
134.article_body: After Gujarat Appellate Authority of Advance Ruling said that paranthas are different from rotis and that 18% GST is applicable on them, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal took to Twitter to say that even the British did not tax food. "Today...the biggest reason for inflation in...the country is the high GST being levied by the central government," he wrote.

135.title: KTR has lunch at fluorosis victim's home in Telangana, shares pics
135.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Thursday visited the home of one of the victims of the fluorosis issue in Nalgonda and had lunch with him. Rao also shared pictures of the same, saying that he's happy the victim's family was provided a "dignity house and livelihood". "More importantly, fluorosis is gone now thanks to Mission Bhagiratha," he added.

136.title: Sensex jumps over 1,000 points, Nifty opens above 17,300
136.article_body: The benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Friday with the Sensex rising 1,068.31 points to 58,303.64. The Nifty was up 295 points to 17,309.30. Infosys, ICICI Bank, SBI, Larsen and Toubro and Bajaj Finance were among the major gainers on the Nifty. All sectors opened higher with Nifty Bank and Nifty IT indices leading the front.

137.title: Power Mech-RITES JV bags ₹499.41-cr order from Bengaluru Metro
137.article_body: Power Mech Projects Limited (PMPL) said it has bagged a ₹499.41-crore order from Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited for the construction of a depot cum workshop at Challaghatta in the Reach-2 Extension under phase 2 of the Bengaluru Metro. The project is awarded to RITES-PMPL, a joint venture of RITES Limited and Power Mech Projects, with 51:49 sharing.

138.title: Dutch Princess forced to move out of student home due to threats
138.article_body: Dutch Crown Princess Catharina-Amalia is under heightened security due to concern that she could be targeted by criminals. The 18-year-old began studying at the University of Amsterdam last month and had moved into an apartment in the city, but her parents revealed that concerns for her safety have forced her to move back to the royal palace in The Hague.

139.title: Person living in Punjab for some time expected to know Punjabi: HC
139.article_body: While hearing a plea by an NDPS convict, Punjab and Haryana High Court said that a person living and working in Punjab for some time is expected to be conversant with the Punjabi language. The plea claimed that the accused could not understand the non-consent memo and consent memo, written in Punjabi, as he is a native of Bihar.

140.title: Moscow to Delhi flight receives bomb threat call; passengers deplaned
140.article_body: Delhi Police have said that they had received a call about a bomb in an incoming flight from Moscow on Thursday night. "The flight landed in Delhi at around 3.20 am. All passengers and crew members were deboarded," the police added. They stated that flight was being checked and an investigation was underway.

141.title: Man suspected of kidnapping, murdering Indian-origin family in US pleads not guilty
141.article_body: The man suspected of kidnapping and murdering an Indian-origin Sikh family, including an eight-month-old baby, in US has pleaded not guilty. Jesus Salgado allegedly kidnapped the family at gunpoint from their trucking business. He has been charged with four counts of first-degree murder with special circumstances. If convicted, he could spend his life in prison without the possibility of parole.

142.title: Delivered cassettes to sex workers, underworld, police: Madhur on money issues
142.article_body: While talking about the financial crunch in his family, film director Madhur Bhandarkar said that for three years he delivered cassettes to people. "I delivered cassettes to all sorts of people - sex workers, girls from beer bars, the underworld, at skyscrapers and bungalows as well as jhuggi jhopris, to Bollywood people [and] to police," he added.

143.title: 2 women smuggling gold worth ₹74 lakh detained at Hyderabad airport
143.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit (AIU) of Hyderabad Customs detained two women at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport for trying to smuggle gold. The officials seized 1,410 grams of gold worth ₹74.02 lakh from their possession. The women, Nahith Sultana and Organs Begum, had arrived in Hyderabad from Dubai. A case has been registered.

144.title: Pune beneficiaries to get over 9,900 PM Awas Yojana flats by March 2023
144.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is set to hand over 9,900 flats under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) scheme by March 2023, officials said. PMC has completed almost 80% work of the flats and officials visited the PMAY's site located at Vadgaon on Thursday. The flats will be allotted on a first-come, first-serve basis.

145.title: 5, including a police officer, shot dead in US; young male suspect arrested
145.article_body: At least five people, including an off-duty police officer, were killed in an "active shooting" incident in the US state of North Carolina on Thursday. A police officer and one other person were shot and suffered non-life threatening injuries. A suspect behind the incident, described as a White juvenile male was taken into custody hours after the shooting, police said.

146.title: Our goals in Ukraine can be achieved through talks: Russia
146.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that the goals of Russia's "special military operation" in Ukraine remain unchanged, but they can be achieved through negotiations. "It takes two sides to have a dialogue. As the West is now taking a very, very hostile stance towards us, it's unlikely that there will be any such prospect in the near future," he added.

147.title: Kerala human sacrifice mastermind posed as woman named 'Sreedevi' on social media
147.article_body: Mohammad Shafi, the alleged mastermind in Kerala human sacrifice case, posed as a woman named 'Sreedevi' on social media and befriended another accused Bhagaval Singh, police said. Shafi reportedly used flowers as the display picture of the fake profile. Police have arrested three people for allegedly killing two women for financial gain.

148.title: Youth caught with electronic device during IBPS exam in Pune; held
148.article_body: A 25-year-old youth was arrested after being caught with an electronic device on his person during an Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) exam in Pune. "The accused told us that with the help of...electronic gadget, he was taking the help of an outsider to solve the questions," police officials said. A case was filed against the accused and outsider.

149.title: 3 teenagers drown to death in 6-foot-deep ditch in Delhi
149.article_body: At least three teenagers drowned to death in a six-foot-deep ditch in Delhi's Pul Prahladpur, police said. The victims were playing in the area on Thursday afternoon when they accidentally slipped and fell into the ditch. The area usually has no water but due to rain in the last few days, rainwater had accumulated creating a six-foot-deep pond, police added.

150.title: 4.8 magnitude earthquake hits Chhattisgarh
150.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.8 on the Richter Scale struck near Ambikapur in Chhattisgarh at 5:28 am on Friday. The National Center for Seismology said that the earthquake occurred 65 km west-northwest of Ambikapur, reports said. The epicentre of the earthquake was at Latitude 23.33 and Longitude 82.58. It had a depth of 10 km below the ground.

151.title: 28-year-old Indian student stabbed 11 times in suspected racial attack in Australia
151.article_body: A 28-year-old Indian student was attacked with a knife and allegedly stabbed 11 times by an unknown assailant in Australia on October 6. Shubham Garg, who is pursuing a PhD from the University of South Wales in Sydney, suffered multiple injuries and is said to be in a critical condition. His family is suspecting this to be a racial attack.

152.title: Pick-up truck rams into stationary truck in Gurugram; 2 killed
152.article_body: Two people were killed after the pick-up truck they were travelling in hit a stationary truck, which was parked after its tyre got punctured, near IFFCO Chowk in Gurugram on Thursday, police said. An inspector said that no precautionary steps were taken to alert other drivers that the truck was stationary. "We're trying to arrest [truck] driver," the SHO said.

153.title: Tattoo on 75-yr-old's arm helps rescuers reunite him with kin in Mumbai
153.article_body: A 75-year-old man found in a paralysed condition in Mumbai's Santacruz East area was reunited with his relatives after the rescuers located his location, the name of which was tattooed on his arm. Vijay Jagtap was found near a bridge on October 7 and had no recollection of how he had reached there, reports said.

154.title: I saw, I stole: Grocer on stealing Karva Chauth puja thalis in Delhi
154.article_body: A shop owner in Delhi was arrested for stealing over a dozen decorative 'thali' hampers used on Karva Chauth. The accused, who owns a grocery store, told police he was unable to resist the decorated plates and stole them when he saw them "unattended" at the Sadar Bazar wholesale market. Police arrested the accused within three hours.

155.title: Centre announces one-time aide for paddy straw pellet makers
155.article_body: Centre said it'll provide one-time financial support for setting up pellet manufacturing and torrefaction plants to enhance paddy straw utilisation in power plants and industries. Union Minister Bhupender Yadav released CPCB guidelines for this. A maximum grant of ₹14 lakh per ton/hour for a non-torrefied pellet plant and ₹28 lakh per ton/hour for a torrefied pellet plant is being provided.

156.title: Material coming out of black hole is like nothing we've ever seen: Scientists
156.article_body: As per a new study on a black hole that ripped a star in 2018, it's spewing out matter despite not swallowing anything in last few years. "No one has ever seen anything like this before," Yvette Cendes, the author of the study, said. It's spitting out material that's travelling at half the speed of light, the study added.

157.title: Hundreds of British citizens forced to cancel India trip due to visa delays
157.article_body: Several UK citizens looking to visit India have been forced to postpone or cancel their trips. This comes after visa agents in the country received notices that they could no longer apply for tourist visas on behalf of the applicant. It is aimed at preventing travel agents from illegally charging fees to get visas processed.

158.title: Rahul Gandhi climbs 80-foot-high water tank in K'taka to wave Tricolour
158.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, Karnataka party chief DK Shivakumar, former CM Siddaramaiah and other party leaders climbed an 80-foot-high water tank in Karnataka to wave the Tricolour. The incident took place in Chitradurga district during Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra. A video showed the leaders waving the flags as spectators cheered and chanted, "Bharat Jodo, Bharat Jodo."

159.title: WeWork India invests in Bengaluru-based conferencing platform Zoapi
159.article_body: WeWork India has invested in Bengaluru-based conferencing and collaboration platform Zoapi for an undisclosed sum. Zoapi was co-founded by Prashanth NS and Chaitanya Vasantarao in 2019 and is a unified conferencing and collaboration solution provider for co-working spaces. Zoapi is also a member of the Intel IoT Solution alliance. WeWork entered the Indian market in 2017.

160.title: Rohit doesn't feature in India's practice match despite being named in XI, fans react
160.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma didn't feature in India's practice match against Western Australia despite being named in playing XI. KL Rahul was named captain in the team sheet despite Rohit being included in the side. "Hope he is not injured," a fan tweeted. "Where is Rohit?" wrote another. India lost the practice match by 36 runs.

161.title: Only green firecrackers to be sold & burst in Chennai during Diwali: Police
161.article_body: Chennai Police on Thursday issued an advisory ahead of Diwali and noted that only "green" firecrackers, those made with chemicals deemed environment-friendly, would be allowed to be sold and burst. "No firecrackers making more than 125 decibel of sound should be manufactured, used or sold," police advisory stated. "Firing of rocket crackers near huts or multi-storey flats is...banned," it stated.

162.title: Gold, silver jewellery worth ₹3,000 cr sold on Karwa Chauth: CAIT
162.article_body: Indian traders' and retailers' bodies CAIT and AIJGF said that gold and silver jewellery reported around 36% of increases in sales on the occasion of Karwa Chauth on Thursday compared to last year. Gold and silver jewellery worth ₹3,000 crore was reportedly sold in India on Thursday. Price of 24-carat gold in Delhi was ₹52,000 per 10 grams, they added.

163.title: Tamil Nadu man arrested for demanding boycott of shops run by non-Hindus
163.article_body: A man in Tamil Nadu was arrested for demanding a boycott of shops run by non-Hindus. Sakthivel, the Karur district coordinator of Hindu Munnani, distributed pamphlets to shoppers appealing them to only shop from Hindu shop owners ahead of Diwali. A case was registered against him under Sections 153A and 505 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

164.title: SC questions need for pre-screening committee for web series, films
164.article_body: The Supreme Court questioned the need for a pre-screening committee for web series, films and other programmes released on OTT platforms. "For OTT satellite transmission is from other countries and not this one even though viewers may be here," a bench of CJI UU Lalit and Justice Bela M Trivedi said. The bench added that it felt pre-censorship is impermissible.

165.title: Reliance is sole bidder for Metro's India business: Report
165.article_body: According to Bloomberg, Reliance Industries is in advanced discussions to acquire Metro AG’s wholesale operations in India. A deal could be finalised as soon as next month. The report said Charoen Pokphand Group is no longer in talks with Metro, leaving RIL as the sole bidder. A deal could value the business at $1 billion to $1.2 billion including debt.

166.title: They put their fingers inside of us: Paris Hilton on sexual abuse at boarding school
166.article_body: Paris Hilton has said she was "sexually abused during medical examinations" at boarding school. She alleged that the Provo Canyon School in US' Utah would "perform cervical exams" routinely on the students. "This wasn't even with a doctor. It was with...staff members, where they would have us lay on the table and put their fingers inside of us," she stated.

167.title: Man shopping with his girlfriend on Karwa Chauth beaten by his wife in UP
167.article_body: A man was beaten by his wife in the market after she caught him shopping with his girlfriend in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad on Karwa Chauth. The man's wife was accompanied by other women. After the video of the incident went viral on social media, police took action against the man for causing a public nuisance.

168.title: MP govt to set up panel to aid SC,ST entrepreneurs: CM Shivraj Singh
168.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has announced a state-level committee will be established to provide facilities to entrepreneurs from SC and ST communities. He said a global skill park is being established in Bhopal jointly with Singapore. MSME and Dalit Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry signed an MoU for creating an ecosystem for the welfare of the community.

169.title: 'Criminals got no gender difference': Cong MLA booked for assaulting woman
169.article_body: Congress MLA Eldose P Kunnapillil, who was booked for assaulting his estranged girlfriend, through a Facebook post, denied having committed any crime on Wednesday. "I have not done anything illegal...Understand that criminals got no gender difference. Power is not the last word for me. God is the only help I believe in," he wrote.

170.title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates $15 mn for glasses to farmers
170.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' ex-wife and philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated $15 million to VisionSpring, a nonprofit that provides eyeglasses to farmers in developing nations. Scott, who received $38 billion in the divorce settlement, has donated more than $12 billion to over 1,275 organisations. Her philanthropic goals are to provide for causes often overlooked in the world of development.

171.title: Key accused in human sacrifice case to undergo psychological test: Kochi Police
171.article_body: Kochi Police Commissioner C Nagaraju on Thursday said that Mohammed Shafi, the prime accused in the Kerala human sacrifice case, will be subjected to a psychological examination. The test will be conducted by an expert doctor from a government hospital, he added. He claimed Shafi is a sexual pervert and a sadist with a mindset to cause injury and death.

172.title: Senior Cong officials to vote from home state or party HQ: CEA
172.article_body: The Congress Central Election Authority (CEA) Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said that in the party Presidential polls, the All India Congress Committee (AICC) officials can cast votes at booths in their home states or at the party headquarters in Delhi. Elections for the post will be held on October 17 and the result will be declared on October 19.

173.title: Disallowed in Delhi, same excise policy doing wonders in Punjab: Kejriwal
173.article_body: The excise policy 2021-22 that the AAP government was not allowed to implement in Delhi has worked wonders in Punjab, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Thursday. The AAP government in Delhi was forced to withdraw the policy in July after Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena asked the CBI to probe into the irregularities in the policy's implementation.

174.title: Tharoor made chair of parliamentary panel on chemicals & fertilizers
174.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has been appointed as the chairperson of the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Chemicals and Fertilizers. Tharoor was earlier chairing the parliamentary panel on information technology and his name for the chemicals and fertilizers panel was suggested by Congress leadership. He is currently contesting the Congress Presidential polls against Mallikarjun Kharge.

175.title: Big B was to star in 'King Uncle' opposite me: 'Aashiqui' actress Anu
175.article_body: 'Aashiqui' actress Anu Aggarwal revealed that veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan was to feature in the 1993 film 'King Uncle'.
