"I was certainly looking forward to working with a legend like him, but, I believe whatever happens is a part of the universal scheme," she added. Amitabh's role was played by actor Jackie Shroff. The film also featured Shah Rukh Khan.

176.title: Excise collection in Punjab crosses ₹4,000 cr in 6 months for 1st time ever
176.article_body: Punjab Finance Minister HS Cheema on Thursday said for the first time ever, the state's excise collection crossed the ₹4,000-crore-mark within the first six months of current financial year. This year's collection so far is 37.62% higher than ₹3,110 crore collected between April 1-October 12, 2021, Cheema said. "This is end of liquor mafia and corruption in Punjab," he added.

177.title: 'Ponniyin...' beats 'Vikram', becomes highest grosser in Tamil Nadu
177.article_body: Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' has beaten Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' to become the highest-grossing film in Tamil Nadu, as per trade analyst Trinath. "At the end of Wednesday, Ponniyin Selvan: I's Tamil Nadu gross stood at around ₹186 crore. It has beaten Vikram's lifetime collection in [the state] in less than two weeks," the analyst stated.

178.title: Quranic commentaries misused: Owaisi on K'taka HC's hijab decision
178.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday claimed Karnataka High Court "misused" Quranic commentaries and translations when it passed a judgement validating hijab ban in educational institutions in the state in March. Its decision was bad in terms of law and content, Owaisi added. The court had said wearing of hijab by Muslim women isn't an essential religious practice in Islam.

179.title: Always wanted to be like Big B, he's still going on at 80: Ranveer
179.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh dedicated his Lokmat Maharashtrian of the Year 2022 award to veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan, who turned 80 on Tuesday. "I wanted to become Bachchan from my childhood, today also I want that...would want to become him in future. He's still going on at the age of 80, he's still acting," Ranveer said.

180.title: Ashok Gehlot is on path of rebellion from Congress: BJP's Malviya
180.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya claimed on Thursday that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot is on the "path of rebellion" from the Congress. Malviya made the remark as he tweeted a clip where Gehlot was purportedly seen praising the work of Coal India and some decisions of Union Minister Pralhad Joshi. "This is in sharp contrast to Congress' belligerence," Malviya tweeted.

181.title: Jammu withdraws order on new voter registration following political row
181.article_body: Jammu administration has withdrawn the direction which authorised tehsildars or revenue officials to issue residence certificates to people living in the district for over a year to enable their registration as voters. The decision came shortly after the directive was issued. The order had led to strong opposition from non-BJP party leaders in the union territory including PDP's Mehbooba Mufti.

182.title: There's no space for students to stand: K'taka minister amid madrassa survey
182.article_body: Commenting on the ongoing survey of madrassas in Karnataka, state minister BC Nagesh said that some of the institutions don't have enough space for students to stand properly. Officials also reportedly claimed that students in some of the madrassas aren't being taught prescribed syllabus. This comes at a time when similar surveys are being conducted in other states including Uttarakhand.

183.title: 2-headed snake, valued at ₹25 crore, found in Bihar; pic surfaces
183.article_body: A two-headed snake, which is valued at around ₹25 crore, has been found in Bihar's Begusarai district. A court in the district has instructed the forest department officials to ensure the safe upkeep of the snake. Forest department officials said the snake was "not of a vicious temperament, known to prey upon only insects and rats".

184.title: Mukesh Ambani visits Kedarnath & Badrinath shrines; donates ₹5 cr
184.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani on Thursday visited the Kedarnath and Badrinath shrines in Uttarakhand. He donated ₹5 crore to the Badri-Kedar Temple Committee. In a video, Ambani was seen visiting the Badrinath shrine with his youngest son Anant Ambani's fiancée Radhika Merchant.

185.title: 24-year-old man gets life in prison for deadliest high school shooting in US
185.article_body: Jury has recommended Parkland shooter Nikolas Cruz, 24, should face life in prison in US' deadliest high school shooting. Jurors decided that while aggravating factors existed, they didn't outweigh mitigating circumstances of his mental health, therefore they couldn't recommend death penalty. Cruz killed 14 students and 3 staff members at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in February 2018.

186.title: Chhagan Bhujbal would have become CM had he not left Sena: Uddhav
186.article_body: Shiv Sena President Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday said senior NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal would have become Maharashtra CM had he not quit Shiv Sena. "When Bhujbal left the Shiv Sena, I must admit that our family was in a state of shock," Uddhav said. "We could not digest it...that one of our own family members had deserted us," he added.

187.title: Carcass of male rhino found in Assam's Kaziranga National Park
187.article_body: A carcass of a male rhino was recovered near the entry gate to Kohora Range in Assam's Kaziranga National Park on Thursday, officials said. "The male rhino is suspected to have passed away due to...old age," an official said. Later, the forest officials collected the horn and stored it in the local treasury of the forest department, the official added.

188.title: Govt issues 'high severity' warning to Zoom users after vulnerabilities found
188.article_body: The government's CERT-In issued a 'high severity' warning saying that multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Zoom products which could allow attackers to prevent meeting participants from receiving audio and video. Affected software includes Zoom On-Premise Meeting Connector MMR before version 4.8.20220916.131 and Zoom Client for Meetings for macOS starting with 5.10.6 and prior to 5.12.0.

189.title: Navy engineer allegedly rapes his 19-year-old friend in Mumbai, probe underway
189.article_body: A Navy engineer has been booked for rape on the complaint of his 19-year-old friend in Mumbai, a police official said. "The teen victim was raped and the accused threatened her against revealing...ordeal to anyone claiming it'd only go on to malign her image," the official added. A case of rape under Section 376 has been registered against the accused.

190.title: Alex Jones ordered to pay $965 million to Sandy Hook families for lies about the massacre
190.article_body: Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones has been ordered to pay $965 million in damages to families of eight Sandy Hook school shooting victims and an FBI agent after falsely claiming for years that the 2012 massacre was a hoax. The families and the agent, who had responded to the attack, had sought at least $550m in the defamation trial in Connecticut.

191.title: Gutter mouth: Smriti Irani on AAP leader Gopal Italia after remark on PM Modi
191.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani has reacted to AAP leader Gopal Italia's purported derogatory remarks against PM Narendra Modi, calling the former a "gutter mouth". "I proffer no outrage, I don't want to show how indignant Gujaratis are but know this...[Aam Aadmi Party] shall be decimated electorally in Gujarat," Irani tweeted. Italia was earlier detained by Delhi Police and later released.

192.title: PhysicsWallah acquires edtech startups PrepOnline and Altis Vortex
192.article_body: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah has acquired PrepOnline, an online learning platform for NEET and Altis Vortex, an exam preparation books publisher, for an undisclosed sum. PhysicsWallah began as a YouTube channel by Prayagraj-based teacher Alakh Pandey in 2016. While Altis Vortex will be merging with PhysicsWallah's editorial team, 35 employees from PrepOnline will be joining the company.

193.title: BJP to observe 4th anniversary of Cong govt in Raj as 'Black Day'
193.article_body: The BJP will observe the fourth anniversary of the Ashok Gehlot-led Congress government in Rajasthan on December 17 as 'Black Day', PTI reported. The party will also hold demonstrations in the state's 200 Assembly constituencies and district headquarters from next month. The state unit of the BJP has also planned a state-level protest and 'jan aakrosh rally' in December.

194.title: 2 bikers ask auto drivers to share cigarette; hack them after they refuse
194.article_body: A couple of bike-borne youths, who were allegedly inebriated, hacked two auto rickshaw drivers, Ajmal and Shameer, in Kerala's Kollam after Shameer refused to share a cigarette with the accused. The accused began assaulting the victims before Shameer managed to escape. The accused then followed him and hacked him. Ajmal was also hacked when he tried to protect Shameer.

195.title: Piramal Pharma receives SEBI's nod to list shares on stock exchange
195.article_body: Piramal Pharma (PPL) said it has received approval from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to list shares on domestic stock exchanges, BSE and NSE. The company said it expects its shares to be listed next week. Piramal Pharma has been demerged from Piramal Enterprises Ltd (PEL) as a part of the simplification of the corporate structure.

196.title: SC refuses urgent hearing on plea against ban on crackers in Delhi
196.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday refused an urgent hearing on a plea against an order banning storage, sale and use of firecrackers in Delhi till January 1, 2023. The court asked the lawyer seeking an urgent hearing to approach the High Court. Supreme Court earlier refused to stay Delhi government's order banning storage, sale and use of firecrackers till January 1.

197.title: Mob of over 200 people attacks Gurugram mosque, assaults people offering namaz
197.article_body: A mob of over 200 people allegedly attacked a mosque in a Gurugram village on Wednesday night and assaulted people who were offering namaz inside. Earlier, the mob had reportedly threatened to expel them from the village and later locked the prayer hall. An FIR has been registered but no arrests have been made so far, police said.

198.title: Wonderful experience to work with Rani Mukerji in 'Aiyyaa': Prithviraj
198.article_body: Recalling his Bollywood debut film 'Aiyyaa', Malayalam actor Prithviraj Sukumaran has said, "It was a wonderful experience to share the screen with Rani Mukerji and work with director Sachin Kundalkar." The film had released in 2012. "I am inundated and grateful with the love and support that my fans from all across the nation are showering on me," he added.

199.title: Let us resume studies: Student on Hijab ban case referred to larger SC bench
199.article_body: Hiba Sheik, a 20-year-old student in Karnataka's Mangalore who was allegedly stopped from entering college to sit for exams in March, said students affected by hijab ban case "cannot afford to wait further". "We urge the Karnataka government to allow us to resume our studies," Sheik said. This comes after the case was referred to a larger bench on Thursday.

200.title: 83-yr-old Maha man swallows 5-cm-long denture; object removed without surgery
200.article_body: Doctors in Maharashtra have removed a single-tooth denture that had got stuck in the food pipe of an 83-year-old man after he accidentally swallowed it. Doctors said they manoeuvred the 5-cm-long and 3-cm-wide object into the stomach, from where they removed it without any surgery. A surgery couldn't be performed as the man had chronic kidney disease and other comorbidities.

201.title: Japanese yen hits its lowest level against the US dollar since 1990
201.article_body: The Japanese yen hit its lowest level against the US dollar since 1990 as one US dollar was worth 147.67 yen on Thursday. This comes as US inflation data indicated higher interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve. Notably, US Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased 8.2% in the 12 months through September.

202.title: 'Stalker' Instagram page uploading videos of women without consent in Hyd, case filed
202.article_body: A case has been registered against an Instagram page by Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police for stalking and sharing photos and videos of women without their consent. The page 'jhamunda_2' shares videos that target a certain group of people, specifically young women and posts their videos with derogatory captions. It also allegedly encourages people to shoot such videos.

203.title: BJP shares video of AAP's Italia using derogatory language for PM's mother
203.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Thursday shared another video of AAP Gujarat chief Gopal Italia purportedly using derogatory language against PM Narendra Modi's 100-year-old mother. Calling Italia a "serial offender", Malviya said, "After constantly referring to women with the 'C' word...[Italia] now calls PM's aged mother 'nautanki baaz'." Italia treats women with sexist disregard, Malviya added.

204.title: 'Conflict tiger' that killed 13 people in Maharashtra captured, pic surfaces
204.article_body: A 'conflict tiger' that killed 13 persons in three districts in Maharashtra over the past 10 months was captured on Thursday by the forest department in Gadchiroli district of the state. The tiger named 'CT-1' has been sent to Gorewada rescue centre in Nagpur for rehabilitation. Officials had ordered the capture of the animal in a meeting on October 4.

205.title: Everything is okay between Chiranjeevi & me: Allu Arjun's father
205.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun's father and Telugu producer Allu Arvind has said that everything is "okay" between him and South star Chiranjeevi. This comes after there were speculations that actor Allu Arjun's family was not on good terms with Chiranjeevi and his son Ram Charan's family. "[Chiranjeevi & I] still visit each other's homes on Diwali and Sankranti," Arvind further stated.

206.title: What is a split verdict and what happens next in such cases?
206.article_body: The Supreme Court today delivered a split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case. A split verdict is passed when the Bench cannot decide one way or the other in a case. Split verdicts can only happen when the Bench has an even number of judges. In case of a split verdict, the case is heard by a larger Bench.

207.title: Photo of a ball of cactus bees wins wildlife photography competition
207.article_body: American photographer Karine Aigne has won the Grand Title in this year's Wildlife Photographer of the Year Competition organised by the Natural History Museum in London. Her photograph, titled 'The Big Buzz', shows a ball of cactus bees vying for a mate. All bees except one are males and they're intent on mating with the single female at the centre.

208.title: Video shows officials asking Dalits to serve branded tea to K'taka CM
208.article_body: The Karnataka Congress has shared a video that purportedly shows officials asking a Dalit family, where CM Basavaraj Bommai had breakfast, to serve only branded tea powder to him. In the video, an official is heard asking the family to get 250 grams of any company's tea. Bommai had breakfast with the Dalit family in Vijayanagara district on Wednesday.

209.title: My pen can never be silenced: Journalist Rana Ayyub on ED charges
209.article_body: "My pen can NEVER be silenced," tweeted journalist Rana Ayyub after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) filed a chargesheet against her under the Prevention of Money-Laundering Act (PMLA). Rejecting the ED's allegations, she said the COVID-19 relief funds raised by her was used solely for helping needy people. She claimed the chargesheet is an example of the abuse of PMLA law.

210.title: Priyanka Gandhi to address 'Parivartan Pratigya Rally' in Himachal on Friday
210.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will start the campaign in Himachal Pradesh for the upcoming state Assembly elections on Friday by addressing 'Parivartan Pratigya Rally' in Solan. Himachal Pradesh Congress Committee (HPCC) tweeted that this rally will officially mark the beginning of Congress' election campaign in the state. Her rally comes a day after PM Modi's visit to the state.

211.title: Foreign-brand cigarettes worth ₹17 cr seized from Guj's Mundra Port
211.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized a container loaded with foreign-brand cigarettes worth ₹17 crore from Gujarat's Mundra Port. The officials conducted a raid and seized 850 containers, each containing about 10,000 cigarettes, from the port on October 11. The DRI has registered a case under the Customs Act and is questioning the importer.

212.title: Working with Salman Khan again in 'Tiger 3' is fantastic: Katrina Kaif
212.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Salman Khan in 'Tiger 3', actress Katrina Kaif has said that working with the actor again is fantastic. Katrina said she has much regard for the franchise as producer Aditya Chopra gives her character "that kind of prominence and importance in the action". The actress said that she loves doing action in a film.

213.title: Oct is 'biggest month' for crypto hacks as $718 mn crypto stolen: Report
213.article_body: Blockchain analysis firm Chainalysis has said, "October is now the biggest month in the biggest year ever for hacking activity." Cryptocurrency worth $718 million has reportedly been stolen from DeFi protocols so far in October, taking the gross tally for 2022 past $3 billion. "At this rate, 2022 will likely surpass 2021 as...biggest year for hacking on record," it added.

214.title: Nothing wrong in promoting Hindi, other Indian languages: BJP leader
214.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Thursday said there is nothing wrong in promoting Hindi and regional languages instead of English. He refuted criticism from opposition leaders Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin that the Centre was imposing Hindi on non-Hindi speaking states. CT Ravi further urged people to come out of the "colonial mindset".

215.title: Very disappointed: Mamata on Asura resembling Mahatma Gandhi at Puja pandal
215.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said she was "very disappointed" over a Kolkata Durga Puja pandal's Asura idol which purportedly resembled Mahatma Gandhi. "What punishment should be given to [the creators]? Public will reply to such [a] shameful act. I...didn't say anything because there could've been protests during Puja," she said. The idol was reportedly later modified following outrage.

216.title: West Bengal govt hands over Letter of Intent to Adani Ports for Tajpur Port
216.article_body: The West Bengal government awarded the Letter of Intent (LoI) of Tajpur Port, located around 170 km southeast of Kolkata, to Adani Ports. An official statement from the government said the overall project will entail an investment of around ₹25,000 crore. The port is expected to create around one lakh direct and indirect jobs.

217.title: Kiara gets annoyed as photographers push senior citizens to click photos, video surfaces
217.article_body: A video shows actress Kiara Advani getting annoyed as media photographers accidentally pushed senior citizens in order to get her photos. Kiara had attended the screening of India's Oscar entry 'Chhello Show' in Mumbai. Amid the rush, Kiara can be heard telling photographers, "There are senior citizens and you are doing this. Careful. What are you guys doing?"

218.title: Michael Schumacher's 20-year-old nephew breaks his spine in fireball crash
218.article_body: Michael Schumacher's 20-year-old nephew David broke his spine after being involved in fireball crash during a DTM race in Germany. David was involved in the collision with Thomas Preining on lap six. It also resulted in another driver's car bursting into flames. David was initially given an all-clear but further scans confirmed a broken lumbar vertebra in his back.

219.title: Social service, training mandatory for violators of traffic rules: Kerala govt
219.article_body: Kerala government has mandated violators of traffic norms to undertake social service and training after nine people died in a road accident in the state. Drivers involved in critical accidents and drunk drivers will mandatorily be engaged in service of at least three days at trauma care centres. Drivers of contract carriages violating norms will mandatorily undergo service-cum-training programme.

220.title: 2 women police constables slap, scold girls for sitting in park in Punjab, video viral
220.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing two women police constables slapping and scolding college girls for sitting in a park in Batala in Punjab's Gurdaspur district. Both the constables have been transferred following the incident. The Batala Police stated that a departmental inquiry has also been initiated against them.

221.title: Son Ram Charan & I returned 80% fee: Chiranjeevi on Acharya's failure
221.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi has revealed that he and his son Ram Charan returned 80% of their remuneration to the makers of 'Acharya' after the film failed at the box office. "I take full responsibility when a film fails and I take the failure of 'Acharya' in my stride," he added. Chiranjeevi further stated that he had no guilt doing 'Acharya'.

222.title: Do I ask people to quit supporting me: Kharge on 'uneven playing field' remark
222.article_body: Congress presidential poll candidate Mallikarjun Kharge reacted to his rival candidate and fellow party leader Shashi Tharoor's "uneven playing field" remark, questioning if he should ask people to stop rendering support. "All delegates came together and decided I should contest...I am their candidate," Kharge further said. Tharoor had claimed that Kharge was receiving preferential treatment.

223.title: US retail inflation rises 8.2% in 12 months through September
223.article_body: US Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased 8.2% in the 12 months through September, after rising 8.3% in August 2022, data from the US Bureau of Labor Statistics showed. Meanwhile, CPI rose 0.4% in September and 0.1% in August. Increases in shelter, food and medical care indices were the largest contributors to the rise in inflation in the last month.

224.title: Singapore, UAE interested in accepting RuPay: Nirmala Sitharaman
224.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that Singapore and United Arab Emirates have expressed their interest in accepting RuPay payments. "We are talking to different countries. Singapore and UAE have all come forward now to make Rupay acceptable in their countries," Sitharaman said. She added that this feature would immensely help Indians travelling to these countries.

225.title: U'khand BJP leader seeks CBI probe as wife killed in clash between UP Police, villagers
225.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP leader Gurtaj Bhullar, whose wife was shot dead in a clash between villagers and UP policemen while chasing a criminal in Uttarakhand's Udham Singh Nagar, has sought a CBI probe into the incident. He has alleged that it was a bigger conspiracy. His wife was shot dead in a crossfire while she was returning home from work.

226.title: Khloé Kardashian has a 'rare' tumour removed from her face
226.article_body: American socialite Khloé Kardashian revealed that she had a tumour removed from her face. She said that she decided to get the bump on her face biopsied seven months after she realised it wasn't budging. The 38-year-old added that doctors told her that the bump on her face was "incredibly rare" for someone her age and advised an immediate operation.

227.title: Jaishankar to pay 2-day visit to Egypt to discuss bilateral issues
227.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will pay a two-day visit to Egypt starting Saturday to discuss bilateral, regional and international issues of mutual interest with Egypt's Foreign Minister Sameh Hassan Shoukry. The Centre said the promotion of bilateral trade, commerce and investments will be one of the focus areas during the visit. Jaishankar will also interact with Egypt-based Indians.

228.title: AAP's Gopal Italia, detained over 'derogatory' comments on PM, released
228.article_body: AAP Gujarat chief Gopal Italia was released hours after he was detained by Delhi Police on Thursday over alleged derogatory remarks against PM Narendra Modi. In two videos that surfaced on social media, he was seen criticising PM Modi's politics and using a cuss word. Italia earlier claimed that the videos were doctored.

229.title: Can never please all: Shaheen on negative comments over Alia's pregnancy
229.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt has reacted to negative comments about the actress' pregnancy. "I will not speak for her because that is her own journey...Having said that, you can never really please everybody," she stated. Shaheen added they are all "very practised" at knowing what to focus on as they are living in the public eye.

230.title: HDFC Life gets final approval from IRDAI for Exide Life merger
230.article_body: HDFC Life Insurance Company said that it has received the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India's (IRDAI) final approval for its merger with Exide Life Insurance Company. HDFC Life had acquired a 100% stake in Exide Life from its parent Exide Industries after issuing over 8.7 crore shares at ₹685 per share and a cash payout of ₹726 crore.

231.title: UP govt announces new EV policy to attract ₹30,000 crore investment
231.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government announced a new electric vehicle policy to promote adoption of clean mobility solutions and create a conducive ecosystem for EVs. The government said the new electric vehicle policy aims to attract investment of over ₹30,000 crore and generate employment for over 10 lakh people. Government said the policy also enables provisions to attract big ticket investments.

232.title: Una-Delhi Vande Bharat train will benefit people of 3 states: Khattar
232.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday said the Vande Bharat Express train, which has been started between Una and Delhi, will greatly benefit the people of Himachal Pradesh, Haryana and Punjab. Passengers will reach Chandigarh from Delhi in under three hours, Khattar said. The Vande Bharat Express train, the country's fourth, will run six days a week.

233.title: 17-yr-old Chennai student dies by suicide, teacher who 'broke up' with him arrested
233.article_body: A Tamil Nadu teacher has been arrested after a 17-year-old student that she was allegedly having an affair with died by suicide, police said. The police suspect that he died by suicide as the teacher ended the relationship with him after she got engaged. The teacher was arrested under POCSO Act and abetment to suicide of IPC.

234.title: There must be uniforms in schools, not hijab or other dresses: BJP MLA
234.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi on Thursday stated that there should only be uniforms in schools, not hijab or other dresses. The Karnataka MLA added, "Uniform in schools is meant to promote uniformity among students." He claimed "separatist mindset" promotes the use of hijab or burqa in schools. He further said, "This mindset was the reason behind India's partition."

235.title: IKEA lays off 10,000 employees after halting Russia operations in March
235.article_body: Swedish ready-to-assemble furniture retailer IKEA said it had to cut 10,000 jobs in Russia after halting its operations in the country in March over the Russia-Ukraine war. IKEA shut down its stores in Russia and said it would sell factories. "The war in Ukraine is a human tragedy that is continuing to affect people and communities," IKEA had earlier said.

236.title: Levi's jeans from 1800s sells for over ₹62 lakh in a US auction; pics surface
236.article_body: A single pair of Levi's jeans from the 1800s was sold for $76,000 (more than ₹62 lakh) at an auction in the US. A 23-year-old vintage clothing dealer named Kyle Haupert, along with Zip Stevenson, bought the pair of jeans. The jeans were first discovered in an abandoned mineshaft in the American West and have suspender buttons on the waistband.

237.title: Was heartbreaking: 'Manike' singer on being in India during SL crisis
237.article_body: Sri Lankan singer Yohani, who sang the song 'Manike' in Ajay Devgn's 'Thank God', said that it was heartbreaking for her to deal with Sri Lankan economic crisis while she was in India. "My family...[is] there and I am in Mumbai, I'm not with them...But the only way through is to face it and keep going forward," Yohani stated.

238.title: Canara Bank writes off ₹1.29 lakh cr in bad loans; hides defaulters' names
238.article_body: Canara Bank has written off ₹1.29 lakh crore in bad loans in last 11 years but has refused to share names of defaulters, according to the bank's reply to an RTI filed by Pune-based activist Vivek Velankar. "Information sought is the personal information of borrowers," the bank's reply read. "Information sought isn't maintained in the manner sought for," it added.

239.title: 2 minor sisters, aged 5 & 3, killed in wall collapse in UP's Sitapur
239.article_body: Two minor sisters were killed when the wall of a kutcha house collapsed over them following heavy rains in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur on Thursday, an official said. Five-year-old Shabia and three-year-old Mehak were playing near the wall that collapsed over them, Sitapur ADM RB Tiwari said. Action has been initiated to give financial assistance to the deceased's family, he added.

240.title: Never thought being good-looking would be negative in acting: Sidharth
240.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said he never thought that being good-looking would be a negative for him in the profession of acting. "I thought we were here to face the camera and be easy on the eyes, but sometimes it tends to be negative," he added. Sidharth stated the audience likes to "see superficial things and not really connect to them".

241.title: Leaders openly supporting Kharge disturbs level playing field: Tharoor
241.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Shashi Tharoor on Thursday claimed that leaders had openly come out to support Mallikarjun Kharge and even summoned meetings in his favour, saying it disturbed the level playing field. He further alleged that leaders were not available for a meeting with him, but they warmed up to Kharge when he visited them, asking for support.

242.title: BJP will retain power with two-thirds majority in Gujarat polls: Shah
242.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said the BJP will retain power with a two-thirds majority in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. "It's because the people of Gujarat have put their trust in the BJP and the BJP has fulfilled...(their wishes) thoroughly," Shah said. He asked the people of Gujarat to be alert so the Opposition doesn't trick them.

243.title: Several parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts on October 15
243.article_body: Several places in Bengaluru will face power outages on October 15 (Friday) as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) will carry out some maintenance and other work. A list of the affected areas has also been released. The affected areas include HSR Layout, Additional East Shivajinagar division, Davanagere, KR Layout, Marenahalli, Arya Nagar and Balaji Layout, among others.

244.title: Girls are wearing hijab because Allah has asked them to do so: Owaisi
244.article_body: After Supreme Court delivered split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "I was expecting...unanimous judgement in favour of girls going to school in Karnataka wearing hijab." "Girls of Karnataka are wearing hijab because Allah has asked them to do so in Quran," he said. "BJP made it an issue out of it," Owaisi added.

245.title: Man, his 2-wheeler washed away in a flooded street in Hyderabad, video surfaces
245.article_body: Amid heavy rains in Hyderabad, a man and his two-wheeler were washed away in a street which had accumulated water with heavy currents. According to a video, the heavy currents caused the two-wheeler and the man, who was rescued by locals, to be taken in its tide. The IMD had issued a yellow alert for Hyderabad for three days.

246.title: Sudanese national illegally staying in Hyderabad deported
246.article_body: A Sudanese national was deported back to his home country after it was found that he was illegally staying in Hyderabad. Mohamed Mahmoud Elawad Fadalla was taken into custody by the Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing. He had come to India in 2015 on a student visa which expired in 2018, after which he continued to stay.

247.title: 39-yr-old assaults doctor in Thane, creates ruckus in hospital; held
247.article_body: A man was arrested in Maharashtra's Thane district for allegedly assaulting a doctor and creating ruckus at a hospital, a police official said on Thursday. The accused entered the hospital in an inebriated condition and fought with a senior citizen who was getting treated for a dog bite, the official said, adding that he assaulted the doctor when he intervened.

248.title: Prime accused in Mohali RPG attack arrested in Mumbai
248.article_body: The prime accused in the rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) attack on Punjab Police's intelligence headquarters in Mohali was arrested in Mumbai on Thursday. Charat Singh had allegedly provided ammunition to those who hurled RPG at the headquarters in May 2022. Charat, an aide of Canada-based gangster Lakhbir Singh, was on parole in a murder case when he committed the crime.

249.title: Stalker kills 20-year-old woman by pushing her in front of moving train in Chennai
249.article_body: A 20-year-old college student was killed after being deliberately pushed by her stalker in front of a moving train at St Thomas Mount Railway Station in Chennai. As per preliminary reports, the duo had a heated argument on the platform before the man committed the crime. The police have formed two special teams to nab the accused, who is absconding.

250.title: Prototype turbine sets world record of generating most power in 24 hrs
250.article_body: Siemens Gamesa's prototype wind turbine generated 359 megawatt-hours of power in one day, setting the world record for the most amount of power generated in a 24-hour period. Power generated by the prototype would be enough to power 18,000 households. The breakthrough was achieved using a set of "revolutionary" blades that are cast in a single piece of recyclable resin.

251.title: 4-week-old lost leopard cub reunited with mother at Mumbai park
251.article_body: A lost leopard cub was reunited with its mother at Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP) by officials of the forest department on Wednesday. A video showed the mother nursing the four-week-old cub before the two disappeared in the bushes. The cub was found by security staff on Monday at Film City, 100 metres from the boundary wall of SGNP.

252.title: I will go on to do bigger things: Sourav Ganguly on exit from BCCI
252.article_body: Sourav Ganguly, who'll reportedly hold no post in BCCI following his end of tenure as BCCI President, said, "I've been an administrator and I'll move on to something else." He added, "I will go on to do bigger things. You can't be a player forever, you can't be an administrator forever. It's been great doing both."

253.title: 6,436 madrasas found unrecognised, survey to continue: UP minister
253.article_body: UP Minority Welfare Minister Dharampal Singh on Wednesday said that 6,436 unrecognised madrasas have been identified in the state so far. He said the survey of UP's unrecognized madrasas will continue as its time period has been extended till October 20. He added that the survey is being conducted in view of better education for the children of minority communities.

254.title: Coal India signs MoU to set up 1,190 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan
254.article_body: Coal India Ltd (CIL) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Rajasthan Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Ltd (RVUNL) to install a 1,190-MW solar power plant in Bikaner district of Rajasthan. The solar plant will be set up in a 2,000-MW solar park in Poogal, Bikaner. The state government has allotted 4,846 hectare land to develop the park.

255.title: We do not support dual employment: Infosys on moonlighting
255.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh spoke on the moonlighting debate in the IT industry and said, "To be clear, we don't support dual employment." He said that the company supports employees working on certain external gig projects after the prior approval of managers. He also revealed Infosys let go of some employees after they were found working in two different companies.

256.title: Huge outrage in Patel community: Kejriwal on Gopal Italia's arrest
256.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday criticised the detention of party's Gujarat unit president Gopal Italia over his alleged objectionable remarks against PM Narendra Modi. Tweeting over his detention, Kejriwal said, "With the arrest of Gopal Italia, there's huge anger among the Patel community in Gujarat." "Why the entire BJP after Italia?" he said in another post.

257.title: 58-yr-old watchman rapes 11-yr-old girl waiting for teacher in Mumbai
257.article_body: Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested a 58-year-old watchman for allegedly raping an 11-year-old girl. According to Mumbai Police, the girl had gone to tuition but decided to wait for her teacher who hadn't reached. Upon seeing the girl alone, the accused took her to a secluded spot and committed the crime. She informed her teacher later, police said.

258.title: Italia is Sardar Patel's descendant, isn’t afraid of jail: AAP MP
258.article_body: After AAP's Gujarat chief Gopal Italia was detained by the Delhi Police from the office of NCW on Thursday, AAP MP Raghav Chadha said, "Gopal Italia is a descendant of Sardar Patel. He isn't afraid of your jail." Italia had been summoned by NCW chief Rekha Sharma over a video allegedly showing him using derogatory language against PM Narendra Modi.

259.title: Singapore Airlines holds talks with Tata over integration of Vistara, Air India
259.article_body: Singapore Airlines (SIA) said that it has held confidential discussions with the Tata Group over a potential integration deal involving Vistara and Air India. "The discussions seek to deepen the existing partnership between SIA and Tata," Singapore Airlines said in a statement. However, it added the discussions were ongoing and no definitive terms were agreed upon yet.

260.title: Infosys' attrition drops to 27.1%, net employee addition at 10,032 in Jul-Sept
260.article_body: Infosys on Thursday reported a 1.3% QoQ drop in its voluntary attrition rate from 28.4% in April-June quarter to 27.1% in July-September quarter. The IT firm added that its net employee addition in the quarter was 10,032 individuals, down 52.6% QoQ from net employee addition of 21,171 people in April-June quarter. Infosys' share of female employees remained stable at 39.3%.

261.title: Cyberabad Police launch 10 more Traffic Task Force teams to regulate traffic
261.article_body: Cyberabad Police launched 10 more 'Traffic Task Force' teams on Wednesday to help regulate traffic movement on busy roads. Cyberabad Police Commissioner, Stephen Raveendra, flagged off the teams comprising two policemen each at IT corridor, Gachibowli. The police teams are provided with motorcycles and they will be able to swiftly act wherever there are traffic jams or slowdowns, Raveendra said.

262.title: Infosys announces share buyback proposal of ₹9,300 crore
262.article_body: Infosys' board of directors approved the buyback proposal aggregating to ₹9,300 crore in order to reward its shareholders. The company will buy back 5 crore shares via the open market route at a price of ₹1,850 per share. The approval was granted alongside the company's Q2 results, where Infosys reported an 11% YoY increase in consolidated net profit.

263.title: 3 accused in Kerala human sacrifice case sent to 12-day police custody
263.article_body: A magistrate court in Kerala's Ernakulam has sent the three accused persons in the alleged human sacrifice case in Kerala to police custody for 12 days. The accused had killed two women, allegedly as part of a human sacrifice for financial gain. One of the accused reportedly confessed that they consumed a portion of the victims' body parts after cooking.

264.title: Meta to let users add legs to their metaverse avatars
264.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has announced that users will now be able to add legs to their metaverse avatars. "I know you've been waiting for this...But...legs are hard, which is why other virtual reality systems don't have them either," Zuckerberg's avatar said during a presentation. Meta also announced that it's bringing avatars to video call, starting with WhatsApp and Messenger.

265.title: Vedantu buys majority stake in test prep platform Deeksha for $40 mn
265.article_body: Tiger Global-backed edtech startup Vedantu said it has acquired a majority stake in offline test preparation platform Deeksha for $40 million. Karnataka-based Deeksha was founded by Sridhar G in 1998 and has centres in Karnataka, Telangana, and Andhra Pradesh. The investment in Deeksha will bring about 13,000 students to Bengaluru-based Vedantu's platform, the latter said.

266.title: Zaporizhzhia does not need Russian fuel: Ukraine nuclear company chief
266.article_body: Ukraine's nuclear energy company Energoatom's chief Petro Kotin has denounced Russia's comments that Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant will need Russian fuel, Reuters reported. "There are a lot of rumours...from Russians...it's not easy to just transfer the fuel loading in Zaporizhzhia from one supplier to another," Kotin said. Fresh fuel supplies are in storage at the plant, he added.

267.title: Veranda Learning acquires CA coaching centre JK Shah Classes for ₹337.82 crore
267.article_body: Edtech firm Veranda Learning Solutions on Thursday announced it has signed a definitive agreement for the acquisition of 39-year-old CA coaching centre JK Shah Classes for ₹337.82 crore. The 39-year coaching centre's alumni include billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla and Union Minister Piyush Goyal, professor JK Shah said. After the acquisition, Shah will remain Chairman for life on the board.

268.title: Army's assault dog Zoom, who fought terrorists despite being shot twice, martyred
268.article_body: Army assault dog Zoom, who was shot twice while fighting terrorists in J&K's Anantnag, succumbed to his injuries on Thursday while undergoing treatment. Zoom passed away at around 12 pm at the Advance Field Veterinary Hospital. The Army had sent Zoom inside the house where the terrorists were holed up during a cordon and search operation.

269.title: Man called me 'B' word, sister Akshara hit him from behind: Shruti Haasan
269.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan revealed her sister Akshara Haasan has beaten up people for her. Recalling an incident, she said, "Somebody called me the 'B' word once, and next thing I hear is this man screaming...Akshara hitting him from behind and saying, 'How dare you call my sister that?'" "I was more like a verbal assault...she is more violent," Shruti added.

270.title: That's the whole point: Dwayne on possible Black Adam vs Superman film
270.article_body: Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson has spoken about the possibility of a film where his character Black Adam fights Superman on screen. When asked about a Black Adam and Superman crossover film, Dwayne replied, "Absolutely. That is the whole point of this [Black Adam's stand alone film], man." 'Black Adam' is a spin-off of 2019 film 'Shazam!', featuring Zachary Levi.

271.title: Nehru's 'insertion' of Article 370 caused Kashmir issue, PM resolved it: Shah
271.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said due to former PM Jawaharlal Nehru's "mistake" of "inserting Article 370, Kashmir was in a mess". Furthermore, he added, "It couldn't be properly integrated with the country. Everybody wanted the removal of Article 370. Prime Minister Narendra Modi removed it in one stroke and completed the integration of Kashmir with the country."

272.title: IIT graduate's AI investment advisory firm raises $1 mn in funding
272.article_body: Artificial intelligence (AI) investment advisory firm Wright Research has raised $1 million in seed funding from Orios Venture Partners. Founded in 2019 by IIT Kanpur graduate Sonam Srivastava, the wealth-tech startup previously raised a pre-seed round with BSE Institute Startup Incubator through Nidhi Seed Support System. Wright Research claims it has almost ₹200 crore in assets under advisory.

273.title: Mumbai to get over 5,800 new CCTVs by the end of December
273.article_body: Mumbai is expected to get 5,837 new CCTV cameras by the end of December as part of the second phase of the surveillance network, home department officials said. The new CCTVs will come up at more than 2,300 locations at the cost of ₹323 crore. Apart from helping curb crime, the cameras are used for traffic management and disaster management.

274.title: Sajid asked me to raise my top and show stomach for giving me role: Actress Kanishka Soni
274.article_body: Actress Kanishka Soni claimed that filmmaker Sajid Khan, who's currently a contestant in 'Bigg Boss 16', called her to his home and asked her to raise her top to show stomach for giving her a role in his movie in 2008. "I feel so insecure while telling you all the whole truth...These powerful personalities can kill me anytime," she added.

275.title: At least cross check: 'Taarak...' director on news reports saying Disha has cancer
275.article_body: Denying reports, which claimed that Disha Vakani is suffering from throat cancer, 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' director Malav Rajda said people should "at least cross check" such news. Stating that the reports are "completely false", Rajda added that such reports "can affect so many people". Disha is known for playing Dayaben in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'.

276.title: Mumbai's Metro Line 2A, 7 clear designs and standards testing
276.article_body: The Mumbai Metro Line 2A (Dahisar to DN Nagar) and Line 7 (Dahisar East to Andheri East) have cleared RDSO (Research Designs and Standards Organisation) testing and will now undergo testing for signalling, an MMRDA official said. "The RDSO test is an important milestone that has been achieved. In the next few days, certification will be issued," the official added.

277.title: 74-year-old man beaten to death with sticks in Varanasi, 5 arrested
277.article_body: A 74-year-old man died after allegedly being beaten with sticks by a group of men near his house in UP's Varanasi on Wednesday night, police said. Five of the 17 accused were arrested while nine police personnel have been suspended. The victim and his son were purportedly attacked when they objected to a group of men fighting near their house.

278.title: 15-year-old girl found hanging from tree in Jharkhand's Dumka
278.article_body: A 15-year-old tribal girl, who studied in Class 10, was found hanging in Jharkhand's Dumka district on Wednesday, said police. The victim's father said that a 22-year-old man, with whom her daughter was having an affair, killed her and hanged her body to make it look like suicide. He said the man told him where he could find his daughter.

279.title: Passenger vehicle wholesales rise by 92% in September
279.article_body: Passenger vehicle wholesales in India surged by 92% to 3,07,389 units in September as compared to 1,60,212 units in the corresponding month last year, the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers said on Thursday. Two-wheeler sales also increased by 13% to 17,35,199 units as against 15,37,604 vehicles in September 2021. Total commercial vehicle sales rose by 39% to 2,31,880 units.

280.title: Iran's Chief Justice orders harsh sentences for 'main elements of riots': Report
280.article_body: Chief Justice of Iran Gholam Hossein Mohseni Ejei has ordered judges to issue tough sentences for the "main elements of riots" sparked after death of Mahsa Amini, a report said. Judges have been reportedly instructed to "avoid showing unnecessary sympathy". Protests broke out after 22-year-old Amini died after being arrested by Iran's morality police for not following Islamic dress code.

281.title: Unable to recover loan from defaulters, bank manager kills self in Puducherry
281.article_body: A bank manager working at UCO Bank in Puducherry hanged himself after being unable to recover the loans from defaulters. The manager reportedly issued loans to many people in order to reach the targets. On being unable to recover loans and bear pressure from higher authorities, he himself took a loan and later committed suicide due to financial pressure.

282.title: Gold, foreign currency worth ₹8 cr seized at Mumbai airport; 7 held
282.article_body: Mumbai airport's Customs department seized 15 kilograms of gold worth ₹7.87 crore in four different cases and also seized foreign currency worth ₹22 lakh in two different cases. As many as seven people were arrested, reports said. In one of the cases, an Indian national was held with gold over ₹5.20 crore, which was hidden in a chest belt.

283.title: British artist live-streams burning 1,000 of his paintings after selling them as NFTs
283.article_body: British artist Damien Hirst burnt 1,000 paintings that were a part of his collection called 'The Currency' after he sold them in digital form as non-fungible tokens (NFTs). After launching the collection in 2021, Hirst gave a choice to buyers to either keep the NFT or acquire a piece of the physical work. He also live-streamed himself burning the paintings.

284.title: Indian startup funding at 2-year low in Q3: Report
284.article_body: Amid global funding winter, Indian startup funding hit a two-year low at $2.7 billion in the third quarter of the year across 205 deals, according to a report by PwC India. The report stated that the decline was the least at the early stage of funding. The funding activity declined to $2.7 billion from $6.6 billion in the previous quarter.

285.title: Man arrested from T'gana for killing IB officer during 2020 Delhi riots
285.article_body: A 34-year-old man, one of the accused in Intelligence Bureau (IB) officer Ankit Sharma's murder during the 2020 Delhi riots, has been arrested from Telangana's Meerpet, officials said. The accused was arrested from a chemist shop that he used to visit, police added. Sharma was stabbed 52 times by sharp-edged weapons, as per the autopsy report.

286.title: Hijab matter will continue to attract SC's attention: Congress
286.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday said, "Supreme Court's split verdict in the hijab case means that the matter will continue to attract the court's attention." Notably, Justice Hemant Gupta upheld the hijab ban in educational institutions in Karnataka, while Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia said, "Wearing hijab is a matter of choice". The court has referred the matter to the CJI.

287.title: I don't even know him: Babar on viral video of Pak TV host criticising him
287.article_body: On being asked about his criticism in reference to a viral video in which Pakistan TV host Aftab Iqbal is seen criticising him, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said, "I don't know who you're talking about. I don't even know him." In the viral clip, Iqbal says, "Babar is no more a star for me...because of his ego issues with players."

288.title: I'm more confident about my game now: Shafali on her form in Asia Cup
288.article_body: India Women opener Shafali Verma, who scored 42 off 28 balls in their semi-final win against Thailand in the ongoing Asia Cup, has said she's more confident about her game now. "The wicket was good to bat and felt good," she said. Shafali has crossed the 40-run mark three times in her five innings in the tournament.

289.title: We have made 12,000 km of rural roads in 8 years in Himachal: PM
289.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday, while addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh’s Chamba, said BJP’s double-engine government is trying to build roads in every village. "We have made 12,000 km of rural roads in eight years in Himachal Pradesh," PM Modi added. "BJP's double-engine government made domestic gas connections available for every home," he stated.

290.title: Gang uses FASTag to cheat people in Delhi with new credit cards; 3 held
290.article_body: Delhi Police has busted a gang which used FASTag to cheat people on pretext of activating credit card services. Police have arrested three men and seized luxury vehicles and SUVs. The accused cheated people of ₹80 lakh in under one month. They were caught while police was investigating a murder case as a gang member lived with the murder accused.

291.title: Purely economic move: Saudi Arabia on OPEC+ decision on oil
291.article_body: Saudi Arabia has rejected criticism of an OPEC+ decision to cut oil production target by two million barrels per day from November, saying the decision has purely economic context. The decision was aimed at curbing market volatility, the statement added. This comes after US President Joe Biden pledged "consequences" for US relations with Saudi Arabia.

292.title: Qatar Airways to hire 10,000 staff ahead of FIFA World Cup
292.article_body: Qatar Airways said that it will add a staff of 10,000 to its workforce in preparation for the FIFA World Cup in the country next month. The company said the hiring will be in line with a broader post-pandemic expansion. A spokesperson said recruitment events were held in the Philippines, India and other countries at the end of September.

293.title: Govt allows exports of 3,97,267 tonnes broken rice backed by Letters of Credit
293.article_body: The government said it will allow overseas broken rice shipments of 3,97,267 tonnes backed by Letters of Credit (LCs) issued before September 8. India had banned exports of broken rice on September 8 to augment supplies and calm local prices, trapping nearly 1 million tonnes of rice that was moved to the ports or was in transit.

294.title: Security enhanced in Karnataka's Udupi after SC's hijab verdict
294.article_body: Security has been ramped up in Karnataka's Udupi district after the Supreme Court's split verdict in the hijab case on Thursday. Police said that measures such as continuous patrolling are being undertaken. "Also, [we are] keeping [a] close watch on social media to make sure no attempts [are] made to harm existing peace in the society," said Udupi SP.

295.title: Nirmala Sitharaman holds bilateral talks with counterparts from four nations
295.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman held bilateral talks with counterparts from Japan, Saudi Arabia, the Netherlands, and South Korea. Sitharaman held discussions on topics including energy crisis, inflation amid the Ukraine crisis, debt sustainability, and climate change. She also discussed key agendas related to Indo-Pacific economic cooperation with Japanese counterpart Shunichi Suzuki.

296.title: Indian man allegedly held captive, tortured by employer in Thailand for $3,000 ransom
296.article_body: A man based in Maharashtra's Thane lodged a police complaint alleging that his younger brother has been held captive in Thailand by his employer company since last one month. He stated the company is torturing him and is demanding $3,000 for his release. He also claimed his brother was taken to an unidentified location once he reached Thailand last month.

297.title: Scientists develop boot that allows people to walk 9% faster
297.article_body: Researchers from US' Stanford University have developed an exoskeleton "boot" that allows its wearer to walk 9% faster with 17% less effort. The footwear's motor works with the wearer's calf muscles to give them an extra push with every step. Researchers said the boot could help people with mobility impairments "move throughout the world as they like".

298.title: IAS officer among 3 arrested after ED raids in Chhattisgarh
298.article_body: Enforcement Directorate on Thursday arrested Chhattisgarh cadre IAS officer Sameer Vishnoi and two others following raids in the state on Tuesday in connection with a money laundering case. The three accused have been arrested under criminal sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). ED also sealed the residence of IAS officer and Raigarh District Collector Ranu Sahu.

299.title: ED files chargesheet against journalist Rana Ayyub in Ketto funds case
299.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a chargesheet against journalist Rana Ayyub in a Ghaziabad court under the anti-money laundering law. It claimed Ayyub raised ₹2.69 crore after launching three fundraiser campaigns on 'Ketto' platform for charity work. However, she used most of the funds for herself and only about ₹29 lakh was used for relief work, the agency alleged.

300.title: Urvashi Rautela reacts to allegations of stalking Rishabh Pant, shares Australia map
300.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela took to Instagram to react to allegations of her stalking cricketer Rishabh Pant. Urvashi claimed she's being bullied and called a stalker just because she "never says wrong" about anybody. Urvashi, who was accused of visiting Australia to stalk Pant, shared Australia map and wrote, "This is for Indian media to see how big Australia is."

301.title: This is as good a line-up as India ever had: Shastri on team for T20 WC
301.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri, during a media interaction, expressed confidence in India's batting unit for the upcoming T20 World Cup, stating, "This is as good a batting line-up as India ever had in T20 cricket." Shastri added, "This Indian team, they have played superbly in Australia. Those tracks suit their batting."

302.title: Tej Pratap claims he experienced Sai Baba's miracle, video surfaces
302.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's eldest son Tej Pratap Yadav has claimed that he experienced Sai Baba's miracle. In a video that has surfaced online, the RJD leader claimed that he had asked for Sai Baba's 'bhabhoot' (ashes) while watching the saint's serial on TV. The next day he found the 'bhabhoot' in an envelope in his office, he claimed.

303.title: Rains to continue in Hyderabad today, yellow alert issued: IMD
303.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert in seven zones of Hyderabad, warning of moderate rainfall and thunderstorms in the city over the following three days. According to the Telangana State Development Planning Society (TSDPS), Hyderabad will continue to receive rainfall till October 16. Many areas of Hyderabad witnessed waterlogging after heavy rains on Wednesday.

304.title: Law student writes tiny notes on pens to cheat in exam in Spain; pics go viral
304.article_body: Pictures of 11 pens on which a law student wrote notes to cheat in an exam have gone viral after a professor at the Spain's University of Málaga shared them on Twitter. "Tidying up my office, I found this university relic that we confiscated from a student a few years ago," the professor tweeted. "What an art," she added.

305.title: There's no spirit of enmity in party: Tharoor on Congress chief poll
305.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Thursday said the party's Presidential election is about two colleagues seeing how to work to strengthen the party. "We are contesting elections, there is no spirit of enmity in our party," Tharoor added. "[Mallikarjun] Kharge sahab is my senior leader and I have worked closely with him," he stated.

306.title: Over 2,000 kg plastic seized, ₹24 lakh fine collected in 3 months: BMC
306.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has seized 2,551 kg plastic and collected ₹24.7 lakh in fines, after taking action against 494 violators in the past three months, civic officials said. "We'll suggest hotels and restaurants to use steel tiffins or another material which can be reused," officials added. If prohibited plastic is found, the BMC levies ₹5,000 as penalty.

307.title: Crypto management startup Pillow raises $18 mn in Series A round
307.article_body: Singapore-based crypto management startup Pillow has secured $18 million in Series A funding round co-led by Accel and Quona Capital, with participation from Elevation Capital and Jump Capital. The company was co-founded in 2021 by Arindam Roy, Rajath KM and Kartik Mishra. The startup earlier raised $3 million from Polygon founders, ShareChat co-founder and Dunzo CTO, among other investors.

308.title: Uddhav faction writes to EC on party symbol, alleges favouritism & foul play
308.article_body: Days after a new poll symbol and party name were cleared by the EC, Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena has written a letter to the EC, alleging "favouritism and foul play" while distributing the party symbols. The EC cleared 'mashaal' for Uddhav's faction, while Eknath Shinde's faction got 'two swords and a shield' as its party symbol.

309.title: DMK to hold protests across Tamil Nadu over 'Hindi imposition' on Oct 15
309.article_body: The DMK's youth and students wings have said they will hold protests across Tamil Nadu against the Centre's "Hindi imposition policies" on October 15. They are opposing the parliamentary panel's recommendation to make Hindi the medium of instruction in central educational institutes. "If implemented, the vast non-Hindi speaking population will be made second-class citizens," CM MK Stalin said.

310.title: AAP Gujarat chief Gopal Italia detained by Delhi Police; party workers protest
310.article_body: AAP's Gujarat chief Gopal Italia was detained by the Delhi Police from the office of National Commission for Women (NCW) on Thursday. He had been summoned by NCW chief Rekha Sharma over a video allegedly showing him using derogatory language against Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "All the AAP hooligans are outside my office creating ruckus," Sharma tweeted.

311.title: Men without self control forced women to wear Hijab: Haryana Minister
311.article_body: Talking about the ongoing hijab row in Karnataka, Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij said that men should strengthen their minds and free women from the hijab. "The men who could not control their excitement upon seeing women forced women to wear hijab," Vij said, adding that the punishment was given to women, because of which they have to cover themselves.

312.title: Samsung gets 1-year exemption from US chip curbs on China: Report
312.article_body: The United States has granted a one-year exemption to Samsung Electronics from the new rules that curbs exports of advanced chips and related equipment to China, The Wall Street Journal reported citing sources on Thursday. Following the exemption, Samsung can continue receiving chip-making equipment and other items it needs to maintain its memory-chip production in China.

313.title: Taiwanese chipmaker TSMC posts 80% rise in Q3 net profit, highest in 2 yrs
313.article_body: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (TSMC), the world's largest contract chipmaker and a major Apple supplier, posted an 80% surge in net profit at $8.81 billion for the third quarter. It's the strongest growth in two years led by sales of its advanced chips used in data centres and electric cars. TSMC's quarterly revenue rose by 36% to $20.23 billion.

314.title: Guards steal ₹83-lakh steel in Mumbai to 'teach a lesson' to employers
314.article_body: Two security guards have been booked in Mumbai for stealing 3,300 kg of steel worth ₹82.5 lakh from the company where they were posted by a security agency. Police recovered a letter which revealed that the accused conducted the theft to "teach a lesson" to their employers (agency officials), who don't pay guards for double time despite charging the company.

315.title: 2,052 encroachments cleared in Bengaluru: BBMP tells Karnataka HC
315.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has informed Karnataka High Court that 2,052 encroachments on stormwater drains (SWDs) have been removed in the city so far. A total of 504 encroachments were yet to be cleared, BBMP's report added. Earlier, the HC told BBMP to complete demolition drive on time or else it will hold back salary of its engineers.

316.title: Shraddha's 'Naagin' trilogy is very much on cards: Producer Nikhil Dwivedi
316.article_body: Amid claims that Shraddha Kapoor's 'Naagin' trilogy has been put on hold, the film's producer Nikhil Dwivedi has confirmed that it is "very much on cards". The trilogy will feature Shraddha as a shape-shifting serpent. Earlier, director Vishal Furia shared that the trilogy would present the much-loved character of Naagin in an entirely new light.

317.title: My mother, sisters never worn hijab: BJP's Poonawalla on SC's verdict
317.article_body: Reacting to the Supreme Court's split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case, BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla said, "My mother and sisters who studied decades ago never worn hijab...but they are practising Muslims." Further, he said, "[Congress] and PFI/CFI who used this issue to stoke...violence...were called out by Karnataka High Court [that they] must not put vote bank above women's rights."

318.title: Temba Bavuma as a captain, as a batter, is a weakness: Aakash Chopra
318.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said that South Africa captain Temba Bavuma shouldn't be in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I'd like to apologise to him as I shouldn't be saying this to an international player...[but] Bavuma as a captain, as a batter, is a weakness," stated Aakash. Bavuma went unsold in the auction for the SA20 league.

319.title: Sona calls Farhan Akhtar 'shameless' over his silence on #MeToo accused Sajid
319.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra took to Twitter and criticised Farhan Akhtar over his silence towards #MeToo accused Sajid Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' participation. "We still haven't heard from the star voice...who was also shameless enough to become UN Women India Ambassador for South Asia," she tweeted referring to Farhan. Earlier, Sona had questioned Javed Akhtar over his silence on Sajid's participation.

320.title: Expected better judgement: K'taka minister on SC's hijab case verdict
320.article_body: Commenting on the Supreme Court's split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case, state School Education Minister BC Nagesh said, "We had expected a better judgement as women worldwide are demanding to not wear hijab/burqa." He added that the Karnataka HC order will remain applicable in interim time. One of the SC judges said there was a "divergence in opinion".

321.title: 2 men attack transgender women in TN, chop off their hair; arrested
321.article_body: Two men were arrested on Thursday for attacking transgender women and chopping their hair off in Tamil Nadu, police said. In a video that surfaced online, one of the accused can be seen chopping off the hair of one of the transgender women and hurling abuses at them. One of the transgender women was also seen with a bruised eye.

322.title: SUV rams into tree on Eastern Express Highway in Mumbai; 2 killed, 5 injured
322.article_body: An SUV rammed into a roadside tree on the Eastern Express Highway in Mumbai's Vikhroli on Thursday, leading to the death of two people, including the car's driver. A total of five others sustained serious injuries and were shifted to a civic-run hospital, police said. The incident took place at around 12:30 am near the Kanjurmarg bus stop.

323.title: Having such a bowler gives confidence: Harmanpreet on Deepti's 3/7 vs Thailand
323.article_body: Praising all-rounder Deepti Sharma for her performance in their 74-run win against Thailand in the Women's Asia Cup T20 2022, India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur said having a bowler like her, who's willing to bowl at any stage during the match, gives confidence to the team. Against Thailand, Deepti picked three wickets while conceding seven runs in her four overs.

324.title: Illegally stored crackers explode in Gurugram house; 6 injured
324.article_body: At least six persons of a family, including two kids, sustained severe burn injuries after illegally stored firecrackers in their house in Gurugram's Nakhrola village exploded. The explosion blew off roof and walls of house and the explosion sound was heard even by villagers a kilometre away. None of the members manufacturing firecrackers had a licence for it, police said.

325.title: 23 Russians escaping military call-up sail to S Korea, 21 denied entry
325.article_body: Twenty-three Russians onboard four yachts have sailed to South Korea since late September to avoid military call-up to fight in Ukraine, but most were denied entry, a South Korean lawmaker said. Authorities rejected entry of 21 Russians due to unclear purpose of visit and lack of documents. This comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered mobilisation of 300,000 additional troops.

326.title: Kriti Sanon walks for designers Shantnu & Nikhil at Lakme Fashion Week
326.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon walked the ramp for designer duo Shantnu & Nikhil on the first day of Lakme Fashion Week. Shantnu & Nikhil's collection, titled Capella, was inspired by the Baroque era. "It's made for people who understand the importance of details, the ones who can't skip a story, and for the ones who dare to rewrite it," Shantnu said.

327.title: Wisden names India's all-time T20I XI, MS Dhoni not included
327.article_body: Ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, Wisden picked India's all-time T20I XI, with MS Dhoni not being included in the side. Wisden included Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Yuvraj Singh, Hardik Pandya, Suresh Raina, Dinesh Karthik (wicketkeeper), Ravichandran Ashwin, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jasprit Bumrah and Ashish Nehra. Wisden stated it picked Karthik over Dhoni because of his latest comeback.

328.title: People chant 'sher aaya, sher aaya' as PM greets people in Himachal's Una, video viral
328.article_body: A video has gone viral showing people chanting 'sher aaya, sher aaya' as PM Narendra Modi greeted them in Himachal Pradesh's Una, where he flagged off India's fourth Vande Bharat train. People were also heard chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' and 'Modi Modi'. PM Modi later also addressed a gathering at the Indira Gandhi Stadium.

329.title: Frivolous and pointless: India after Pakistan's remarks on Kashmir at UNGA
329.article_body: India criticised Pakistan for raising the Kashmir issue at the UNGA debate on the Russia-Ukraine situation, calling Pakistan's remarks "frivolous and pointless". A Pakistani diplomat raised the Kashmir issue to draw parallels between the two situations. India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Ruchira Kamboj said, "Entire territory of J&K is and will always be an integral part of India."

330.title: Russia attacked Kyiv area with Iran-made kamikaze drones: Ukraine
330.article_body: Iran-made kamikaze drones hit regions around the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, on Thursday morning, officials said. There was no immediate information on casualties, but Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's office said "critical infrastructure facilities'' in the area had been hit. In recent weeks, Ukraine has reported a series of Russian attacks in which Iran-made Shahed-136 drones were used.

331.title: HyperSocial CEO mentions firm's work culture in grandmother's death post; criticised
331.article_body: HyperSocial CEO Braden Wallake, who had gone viral for his crying selfie after layoffs at his company, announced the death of his grandmother on LinkedIn and then moved on to talk about the work culture at his firm. Criticising his post, a user wrote, "This post went from the bad news of grandma passing to promoting the company."

332.title: Kishore Kumar's work inspires me to push boundaries: Ayushmann
332.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana said Kishore Kumar's work inspires him to "push boundaries and explore uncharted territories". He said he's been listening to the late singer's 'Aake Seedhi Lage Dil Pe Jaise' song on loop since the beginning of Dream Girl 2's shoot. "He has effortlessly rendered both male and female voices for this song," he added, calling it his "massive inspiration".

333.title: Several PCCs welcomed Kharge but not me: Tharoor
333.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor, who is running for his party's President post, said that his rival Mallikarjun Kharge was welcomed in several Pradesh Congress Committees by big leaders but the same wasn't done for him. "I visited PCCs but PCC chiefs weren't available. Not complaining, but don't you see a difference in treatment?" he said during a press conference.

334.title: Previous governments failed to understand people's needs: PM in Himachal
334.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday, while addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh’s Una, said his government is fulfilling people's needs which previous governments at the Centre and Himachal Pradesh failed to understand. PM Modi inaugurated India’s fourth Vande Bharat Express train from Una railway station today. "The festival of Diwali has arrived early for Una and Himachal Pradesh," he stated.

335.title: Govt approves ₹6,600 crore PM-DevINE scheme for North East region
335.article_body: Union Cabinet approved the Prime Minister's Development Initiative for North East Region (PM-DevINE) scheme for the remaining four years of the 15th Finance Commission from 2022-23 to 2025-26. The scheme will have an outlay of ₹6,600 crore. PM-DevINE is a Central Sector Scheme with 100% Central funding and will be implemented by the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region.

336.title: Bus carrying flood affected people catches fire in Pakistan, 18 dead
336.article_body: At least 18 people, including eight children, have died after a bus carrying flood victims caught fire in Pakistan on Wednesday. The bus, which was heading from the southern port city of Karachi to Khairpur Nathan Shah, caught fire after the air conditioning unit short-circuited. Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif expressed deep grief over the loss of lives in the incident.

337.title: New India takes pride in its culture, traditions & heritage: CM Yogi
337.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said "new India" takes pride in its culture, traditions and spiritual heritage and is strengthening national unity. "Our priests and other spiritual and great personalities have always shown us that the path to salvation lies in ‘lok kalyan’ (people’s welfare)," he added. "The new India greatly values its Vedas and Upanishads," he stated.

338.title: Maxwell key part of our team, just needs free mindset: Hazlewood
338.article_body: Talking about teammate Glenn Maxwell's form ahead of the 2022 T20 World Cup, Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said the all-rounder is a key part of their team who adds "balance". Hazlewood added, "I think Maxwell just (needs a) free mindset and (to) play his game." Notably, Maxwell hasn't scored in double-digits in his last six T20I innings.

339.title: Amazon to launch internet satellites on ULA rocket in early 2023
339.article_body: Amazon will launch its first two prototype satellites for a planned internet-from-space constellation in early 2023. A new rocket from Boeing-Lockheed's United Launch Alliance (ULA) will be used. The prototype satellites will be part of Amazon's Kuiper network, which is a planned constellation of 3,236 low-Earth orbiting satellites that will beam broadband internet to the world's remote parts.

340.title: RBI to submit report on failure to tackle inflation since January
340.article_body: The RBI will have to submit a report to the Centre giving detailed reasons for the failure to contain prices even as inflation has been above the upper tolerance limit for nine straight months. This will be the first time since the onset of the Monetary Policy Framework in 2016 that the RBI will be asked to explain its actions.

341.title: Hyd Police shares list of roads to avoid due to heavy traffic
341.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police shared list of roads to avoid due to heavy flow of traffic and peak hours. The police asked commuters to avoid roads near Taj Mahal Hotel, Apollo Hospital lane, BVB Jn, Journalist Colony and Road No 45 towards Jubilee Hills Checkpost. Traffic was hit in several areas on Wednesday night after heavy rain lashed the city.

342.title: Man gets ₹201 back from stranger he had helped last year; chat goes viral
342.article_body: A post by a LinkedIn user named Kamal Singh about receiving ₹201 from a stranger whom he had helped last year has gone viral. "On opening the chat I saw I transferred money to this guy 1.5 years back as a small help after reading his crowdfunding request on [social media]," Singh wrote along with a screenshot of their chat.

343.title: Gunshots fired at anti-hijab protestors in several Iranian cities
343.article_body:
Gunshots were fired as Iranian security forces confronted anti-hijab protestors in several cities on Wednesday. Protests are taking place in Iran over the death of 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini. 
Amini died on September 16, days after being detained by Iran's morality police over improper hijab. Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei has accused the country's "enemies" of stoking "street riots".

344.title: Can lead to 3rd world war: Russia on admission of Ukraine to NATO
344.article_body: The admission of Ukraine to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) can result in third world war, the deputy secretary of the Security Council of the Russian Federation, Alexander Venediktov, has said. Venediktov also repeated a Russian position that the West, by helping Ukraine, indicated that "they are a direct party to the conflict".

345.title: Need for new laws to curb superstition: CPI(M) on Kerala's human sacrifice case
345.article_body: The CPI(M) condemned the alleged human sacrifice incident reported in Kerala and said that there's need for new laws to curb such superstitious practices and urged strict implementation of the existing laws. Such an incident, which shocked human conscience, cannot be prevented by law alone but a mass public movement should emerge in society against such practices, the party added.

346.title: Auto-rickshaw driver arrested for molesting school student in Delhi
346.article_body: A 25-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was arrested from Delhi's Saket area for allegedly molesting a school student, police said. The incident took place on September 30, police added. The accused misbehaved with the girl by passing lewd and sexual comments, and also touched her inappropriately while she was on her way to meet her mother in Lajpat Nagar, police stated.

347.title: Priest stops Dalit youth from entering temple in Karnataka
347.article_body: A Dalit youth was reportedly stopped from entering the Mulkatamma temple by the priest in Karnataka's Tumakuru district. He said he went to the temple with flowers, coconut and incense sticks to pray but the priest refused to take the offerings and threw him out. The locals accused the priest of practising untouchability.

348.title: Musk sells $1 million worth of 'Burnt Hair' perfume within hours of launch
