348.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk earned a million dollars within a few hours after he sold 10,000 bottles of his newly-launched 'Burnt Hair' perfume. Musk also changed his Twitter bio to 'perfume salesman' and on Thursday tweeted, "Please buy my perfume, so I can buy Twitter." The perfume is priced at $100 and being sold under The Boring Company.

349.title: 700 stubble burning incidents reported so far in 2022: Punjab minister
349.article_body: As many as 700 incidents of stubble burning have been reported in Punjab so far this year, state’s Agriculture Minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal said on Wednesday. "This year 700 incidents...reported…as compared to over 2,500 incidents during the same time in previous years," Dhaliwal added. "We're constantly trying that stubble should not be burnt at least in Punjab," he stated.

350.title: Russia to use its own nuclear fuel at Zaporizhzhia plant: Rosenergoatom
350.article_body: The Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant will switch to Russian nuclear fuel after its current reserves run out, Russia's nuclear power operator Rosenergoatom reportedly said. This comes after Ukraine's nuclear energy company Energoatom accused Russia of not allowing its vehicles carrying diesel fuel to access the plant. The plant had suffered a "blackout" which increased radiation emergency risk.

351.title: 2 women jailed for husbands' murder observing Karwa Chauth fast in UP
351.article_body: About 50 women prisoners in Lucknow and 12 in Gorakhpur are observing Karwa Chauth fast after the UP government permitted them to perform all rituals associated with the festival. Among those fasting are two women prisoners accused in the murder of their husbands. Married couples who are in jail will be allowed to meet on the occasion, said an official.

352.title: I'm speechless: Tanushree on Sajid Khan's participation in 'Bigg Boss 16'
352.article_body: Actress Tanushree Dutta said she's "speechless" about filmmaker Sajid Khan's entry as a contestant in Salman Khan's show 'Bigg Boss 16'. "I am appalled too. I am speechless at the sheer irresponsibility of this action and the impact it would have on the public," she said. Several women accused Sajid Khan of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement in India.

353.title: Hindalco, NALCO shares rise as US mulls Russian aluminium ban
353.article_body: After aluminium prices surged nearly 7.3% on the London Metal Exchange following reports of the US considering a ban on Russian aluminium amid the Russia-Ukraine war, stock prices of Hindalco, Vedanta and NALCO rose by 1.5-3%. NALCO rose by 3.28% in opening trade on the National Stock Exchange, while Hindalco was up 3.5% and Vedanta surged by 1.2%.

354.title: Dalljiet reacts as ex-husband and BB16 participant Shalin says they are best friends
354.article_body: Actress Dalljiet Kaur has reacted after her ex-husband and Bigg Boss 16 participant Shalin Bhanot said they're best friends during an episode of the reality show. "No I'm not your best friend...Meeting once in...two months for the sake of my child does not qualify as friendship," she added. "Leave me out of your fictions and stories please," she further said.

355.title: Pic shows smoke-filled cabin of SpiceJet flight after it makes emergency landing in Hyd
355.article_body: A Twitter user shared an image of a smoke-filled cabin of a SpiceJet flight after the plane made an emergency landing at Hyderabad airport on Wednesday night due to the incident. While sharing two videos of the landing, he also said that the passengers "suffered" and had "blacked out with fear". According to officials, DGCA is probing the incident.

356.title: Google approves Donald Trump's app Truth Social for Play Store
356.article_body: Google has approved former US President Donald Trump's social media application Truth Social for distribution in the Google Play Store, a company spokesperson said. Truth Social had not been available in the Play Store due to insufficient content moderation, a Google spokesperson said in August. Donald Trump launched Truth Social after he was permanently banned from Twitter in January 2021.

357.title: Mercedes-Benz sees 28% rise in sales in India in Jan-Sept 2022
357.article_body: Mercedes-Benz India has registered 28% rise in sales, with 11,469 units sold in Jan-Sept 2022, the company said. The German carmaker sold 8,958 units in India in the same period last year. The statement added that the total order bank of Mercedes-Benz India as of September 2022 is over 7,000 units. The company sold 11,242 units in India in 2021.

358.title: Vedanta shareholders approve shifting its cash from reserves
358.article_body: The shareholders of Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta Limited on Tuesday approved Vedanta Resources' proposal to move money out of its reserves and into its balance sheet. London-based Vedanta Resources holds about 70% stake in Vedanta Limited. Vedanta said in a regulatory filing that 100% of Promoter and Promoter Group shareholders as well as public institutions voted in favour of the proposal.

359.title: Car rental startup Zoomcar may go public via SPAC deal: Report
359.article_body: Bengaluru-based car rental startup Zoomcar has reportedly reached an agreement to go public via a merger with blank-cheque firm, Innovative International Acquisition Corporation. The merger with a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) implies a pro forma enterprise value of about $456 million for the business. Zoomcar was founded by Greg Moran and David Back in 2013.

360.title: Bengaluru likely to see rain for the rest of the week: Forecast
360.article_body: Bengaluru will see moderate to heavy rain today with thunderstorms and lightning, the Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre (KSNDMC) said. Meanwhile, Skymet Weather Services said that the city will likely see rainfall throughout the week. Areas within BBMP limits will have maximum and minimum temperatures around 28 and 21 degrees Celsius respectively, state's weather department said.

361.title: Assured placement with Gaming & eSports certificate program: Hero Vired
361.article_body: Hero Vired & NODWIN Gaming has launched a Certificate Program in Gaming and eSports with placement assurance. Individuals in their final year or with bachelor's degrees & experienced professionals are eligible to apply, the company said. It enables candidates to explore gaming & eSports industry with hands-on learning on various aspects like UI/UX, game mechanics, league ops, and game marketing.

362.title: Love the kind of thriller stories Sriram Raghavan tells: Katrina Kaif
362.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said she loves the kind of thriller stories director Sriram Raghavan tells and called him one of her favourite directors. The actress has collaborated with Raghavan for the first time for his upcoming film 'Merry Christmas', which also features Vijay Sethupathi. Talking about working with Sethupathi, Kaif said he is "a phenomenal actor".

363.title: 46-yr-old man sexually assaults 6-yr-old girl in Mumbai; arrested
363.article_body: A 46-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a six-year-old girl in Mumbai's Kandivali West. The girl was playing near her house when the accused, a welder, reportedly took her to a deserted place and sexually assaulted her behind a tree. He also beat up the child and threatened her against telling anyone about the incident, said police.

364.title: You see that guy? I'd pick Umran in the squad all the time: Wasim Akram
364.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said he would've picked pacer Umran Malik in his squad all the time. "You see that guy? Umran...he's quick...The more he plays, the better he will become," stated Wasim. Umran has played three T20Is for India so far and has reportedly been shortlisted as one of the net bowlers for the upcoming T20 World Cup.

365.title: UN demands Russia to reverse 'illegal' annexations in Ukraine
365.article_body: The UN General Assembly has voted 143-5 to condemn Russia's "attempted illegal annexation" of four Ukrainian regions and demand its immediate reversal. Russia formally annexed Ukraine's Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions through referendums which the West dismissed as a sham. Ukraine's UN ambassador, Sergiy Kyslytsya, called the vote at UN "amazing" and "a historic moment".

366.title: Family sacrifices 14-yr-old daughter in Gujarat for 'financial benefits'
366.article_body: A family in Gujarat's Gir Somnath district allegedly killed their 14-year-old daughter as a "sacrifice for financial benefits", police said. The girl was studying in Surat till six months ago, police added. Her parents, for unknown reasons, took her leaving certificate from the school and brought her to their native village and kept her at the farm, police added.

367.title: Matter of choice, nothing more, nothing less: Judge in K'taka hijab ban split verdict
367.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday delivered a split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case. While Justice Hemant Gupta dismissed the appeals challenging the Karnataka High Court order, Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia said, "The high court took a wrong path...It's ultimately a matter of choice, nothing more, nothing else. Uppermost in my mind was the education of the girl child."

368.title: Emily Ratajkowski says she's 'single' amid relationship rumours with Brad Pitt
368.article_body: Supermodel Emily Ratajkowski has confirmed that she is "single" amid the rumours that she was seeing Hollywood actor Brad Pitt. "I'm newly single for basically the first time in my life ever," she said in her latest interview. Emily added she is "enjoying the freedom of not being super worried" about how she is being perceived.

369.title: Peace visible on ground due to PM's special focus on Kashmir: MoS Finance
369.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Wednesday said PM Narendra Modi’s special focus on Kashmir is bearing fruits as peace is visible on the ground. Furthermore, he said that it’s due to PM Modi’s vision that central ministers are meeting stakeholders by visiting them at their doorsteps as a part of government’s public outreach programme in J&K.

370.title: Will consult Sonia, Rahul if elected as Congress President: Kharge
370.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday said that he believes in collective leadership and if elected as party’s chief, he will consult party leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi on organisational matters. "Under their leadership, our party had formed government twice and framed a number of welfare schemes for the poor," Kharge added.

371.title: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah scores fastest hat-trick in Champions League history
371.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah on Wednesday scored the fastest hat-trick in the history of Champions League. The 30-year-old Egyptian came on as a substitute against Rangers in the 68th minute and netted his three goals in the 75th, 80th and 81st minutes, respectively. He set the record by scoring the hat-trick in under seven minutes.

372.title: There's a vibe of extreme nervousness at home: Shaheen on Alia's pregnancy
372.article_body: Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt shared that there's "a vibe of extreme nervousness and excited anticipation" at home about the actress' pregnancy. "Alia is the first among us, siblings, who will be welcoming a baby," Shaheen said, adding that the whole family is "waiting to meet the new member". Alia had announced her pregnancy in June this year.

373.title: Ukraine says it 'shot down 4 Russian helicopters' in 18 mins
373.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry said that the country's forces in a span of just 18 minutes shot down four Russian helicopters "that were spoiling beautiful autumn skies in the south of Ukraine" on Wednesday. The aircraft, believed to be Soviet-era Ka-52 helicopters, were providing fire support to the ground occupation forces, Ukraine's Air Force said. Russia began invading Ukraine in February.

374.title: Wipro shares fall 6% to hit fresh 52-week low after Q2 results
374.article_body: Wipro shares fell 6% to hit a fresh 52-week low of ₹383.25 apiece on the BSE on Thursday after it reported a consolidated net profit of ₹2,659 crore for the second quarter, which was 9% less than the corresponding period last year. Its revenue from operations increased by 14.60%. Wipro gave a revenue growth guidance of 0.2-2% for October-December quarter.

375.title: IHH Healthcare starts talks with SEBI on Fortis open offer: Report
375.article_body: Malaysia's IHH Healthcare has started discussions with authorities in India, including SEBI to explore the next step for its stalled open offer for an additional 26.1% stake in Fortis Healthcare, The Economic Times cited sources as saying. The Supreme Court had in September ordered a forensic audit of the share sale of Fortis to IHH Healthcare executed in 2018.

376.title: India defeat Thailand, reach Women's Asia Cup T20 final for the 4th time in a row
376.article_body: Two-time champions India defeated first-time semi-finalists Thailand by 74 runs on Thursday to reach the Women's Asia Cup T20 final for the fourth time in a row. Batting first, India posted a total of 148/6, with opener Shafali Verma top-scoring with 42(28). India restricted Thailand to 74/9 in their 20 overs, with Deepti Sharma registering figures of 4-1-7-3.

377.title: Don't have any other babies looming, my peers told me to have 500 kids: Musk
377.article_body: On being asked if he's fathered any more children, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "I'm pretty sure there are no other babies looming." During an interview with The Financial Times, Musk said that some of his peers have told him to have 500 children, adding that he thinks it would be a "bit weird".

378.title: Hyderabad-bound SpiceJet flight lands safely after smoke detected in cabin
378.article_body: A Goa-Hyderabad SpiceJet flight landed safely at its destination after smoke was detected in the cabin during the descent on Wednesday. While all passengers were safely disembarked, as per airport sources, a female passenger fell ill due to the incident and is currently undergoing treatment. A total of 86 passengers were said to be on board.

379.title: Bail plea of accused in Delhi riots larger conspiracy case rejected
379.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday rejected the bail plea of Athar Khan, an accused in the larger conspiracy case in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots. "On the perusal of the charge-sheet and accompanying documents...allegations against the accused Athar Khan are prima facie true," the court said. Khan had purportedly told others that the time has come to "burn Delhi".

380.title: PM Modi flags off 4th Vande Bharat Express train from Himachal's Una
380.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated India's fourth Vande Bharat Express train from Himachal Pradesh's Una railway station on Thursday. The train, which will run between Una and New Delhi, accelerates to 100 km per hour in just 52 seconds. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Union Minister Anurag Thakur were also present during the event.

381.title: Babar Azam must come out of average mindset, think big: Shahid Afridi
381.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has criticised Babar Azam, stating that the Pakistan captain "must come out of [the] average mindset and think big". Afridi made the comment in response to Babar's remarks before Pakistan's match against Bangladesh in the ongoing tri-series in Christchurch. Babar had said he was considering giving Bangladesh a target of 160 runs.

382.title: Supreme Court delivers split verdict in Karnataka hijab ban case
382.article_body: The Supreme Court gave a split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case as one of the judges said there was a "divergence in opinion". While Justice Hemant Gupta dismissed the petitions challenging the Karnataka High Court order and upheld the hijab ban in educational institutions in the state, Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia said, "Wearing hijab is a matter of choice".

383.title: Cyber frauds can now be reported at all 32 police stations in Pune
383.article_body: Citizens will now be able to file cyber fraud complaints at all the 32 police stations in Pune, said Commissioner Amitabh Gupta on Wednesday. Earlier, people had to travel to the cybercrime police station at Shivajinagar headquarters for it. "We have trained the staff at all police stations about how to investigate cybercrime cases," said Police Inspector Kumar Ghadge.

384.title: Two arrested for smuggling over 30,000 packs of illegal cigarettes in GB Nagar
384.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar unit of Uttar Pradesh Special Task Force arrested two people on Wednesday for smuggling over 30,000 packets of illegal cigarettes, worth ₹1.5 crore. The police arrested the suspects from the Pilkhuwa toll plaza in Hapur and recovered 21,200 packets of cigarettes from Indonesia and 9,000 packets from South Korea, along with a truck.

385.title: Kohli reacts to on-field situations, Rohit prepares in meetings: NZ's Corey
385.article_body: Talking about the captaincy approach of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, ex-NZ all-rounder Corey Anderson, who played under both the players in IPL, said, "Virat...sees things as they are and then goes by that. Rohit [is] involved in a lot of those meetings." Corey added, "I think Rohit is sort of just very proactive around how he does things."

386.title: Europe is likely entering another COVID-19 wave, warns WHO
386.article_body: The World Health Organization and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) said there are indicators suggesting that another wave of COVID-19 infections has begun in Europe. "Although we're not where we were one year ago, it's clear that...COVID-19 pandemic is still not over," WHO Europe Director Hans Kluge and ECDC Director Andrea Ammon said in a joint statement.

387.title: Massive fire breaks out at film studio in Kolkata, 15 fire tenders deployed
387.article_body: A massive fire broke out at Eskay Movies studio in the Kudghat area in West Bengal's Kolkata on Thursday morning. With 15 fire tenders pressed into action, the fire was brought under control, fire officials said. Kolkata Police's disaster management force reached the spot where minister Aroop Biswas was also present. The fire reportedly broke out in the studio's godown.

388.title: Queen Elizabeth's life features in new comic book; pics surface
388.article_body: The life of Queen Elizabeth, Britain's longest-reigning monarch, has featured in a new comic book by TidalWave Comics. The comic book covers her public and private life, big events, family scandals, and crises. She passed away on September 8 aged 96 and was laid to rest alongside her husband Prince Philip on September 19.

389.title: Would love to make biopic on Big B, but there’s no one to play him: Balki
389.article_body: Director R Balki said he would love to make a biopic on Amitabh Bachchan but he thinks there's no one who can play him on screen. "There's not a single actor in this country who would dare to step into those shoes," he said, adding that even Abhishek wouldn't play his father on screen. "He knows it's impossible," Balki added.

390.title: Electronics dealer in Pune cheats finance firm of ₹22.74 lakh
390.article_body: An electronics and home appliance dealer in Pune allegedly cheated a finance company of ₹22.74 lakh. The accused, Pritesh Shivale, used customers' documents to avail loans from the company, according to police. When the monthly instalments were deducted from customers' accounts, they denied having purchased any home appliances. Shivale is suspected to have cheated 80 to 90 customers.

391.title: HCL disapproves dual employment, says moonlighting not a 'big issue within firm'
391.article_body: Speaking on the issue of moonlighting, HCL Technologies said that while it doesn’t approve "dual employment", it has not been a major issue within the company. HCL's Chief People Officer Ramachandran Sundararajan said, "Everybody who signs up to work for HCL…is signing up employment contract which requires exclusivity." Earlier, Wipro fired 300 employees found to be moonlighting.

392.title: Admired Emma in a way I could never explain: 'Harry Potter' star Tom Felton
392.article_body: 'Harry Potter' actor Tom Felton said he "loved and admired" his co-star Emma Watson in a way he could never explain to anybody else. "I've always had a secret love for Emma, though not perhaps in the way that people might want to hear," he said, adding there was "most definitely" a spark between the two, but at different times.

393.title: North Korea test-fires 2 cruise missiles capable of carrying nuclear weapons
393.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un oversaw the test launch of two nuclear-capable long-range strategic cruise missiles, state media reported. The two missiles flew for 10,234 seconds and "clearly hit the target 2,000 km away". The state media added that test was aimed at "enhancing the combat efficiency and might" of cruise missiles deployed "for operation of tactical nukes".

394.title: BJP only national party left, Cong reduced to brother-sister organisation: Nadda
394.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda said BJP is the only national party left in the country, while Congress has reduced to a "party of a brother and sister". "There's no other national party left. I say this with full responsibility that Congress has shrunk and it's neither a national party nor a Bharatiya party," Nadda added.

395.title: Vistadome coaches in Mumbai trains generate ₹7.32 cr revenue in 6 months
395.article_body: Around 56,895 passengers travelled in Vistadome coaches installed in several Mumbai trains in the last six months and generated ₹7.32 crore in revenue during this time. Mumbai-Madgaon Jan Shatabdi Express alone generated revenue of ₹3.35 crore with 16,078 Vistadome coach passengers. A few other trains which have Vistadome coaches are Mumbai-Pune Deccan Express, Deccan Queen and Pragati Express.

396.title: Sanju should be in scheme of things for ODIs, but not at cost of Pant: Jaffer
396.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Sanju Samson has impressed him a lot with his recent performances and the 27-year-old should be included in the team for the ODIs. Jaffer, however, also added, "Samson should be in the scheme of things...but not at the cost of Rishabh Pant." Samson remained unbeaten in the recently-concluded South Africa ODIs.

397.title: Please buy my perfume, so I can buy Twitter, says Musk; Twitter users react
397.article_body: After offering to buy Twitter again, the world's richest person Elon Musk recently launched a new business venture, a 'Burnt Hair' perfume. On Thursday, he tweeted, "Please buy my perfume, so I can buy Twitter." Meanwhile, a Twitter user commented, "Please hire me, so that I can buy a Tesla," while another wrote, "In that case, I'm buying 10."

398.title: India reports 2,786 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,509
398.article_body: India reported 2,786 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,139 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,509. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,847 following 12 casualties in the last 24 hours.

399.title: Jeev Milkha Singh gets 63 challans for Mercedes Benz car he sold in 2014 for ₹35 lakh
399.article_body: Golfer Jeev Milkha Singh has moved court in Chandigarh, seeking FIR against a car dealer and purchaser after he received court notices pertaining to 63 unpaid challans for Mercedes Benz car he sold in 2014 for ₹35 lakh. The challan violations, which have been accruing since 2015, amount to ₹83,000. He had sold the car to a Delhi-based firm director.

400.title: UP minister's nephew tries to ram his car into hotel staff for refusing to serve him food
400.article_body: An Uttar Pradesh minister's nephew was booked by the police after he allegedly tried to ram his car into a group of restaurant workers for refusing to serve him food. The hotel's owner, who claimed to be a BJP worker, said that he went to the minister’s house to complain but was asked to return as the latter was sleeping.

401.title: France accuses Russia of stoking Armenia, Azerbaijan conflict
401.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday accused Russia of purposefully provoking the recent clashes between Armenia and Azerbaijan. "It's an effort by Russia to destabilise. It wants to create disorder in the Caucasus to destabilise all of us," Macron said. The worst fighting between Armenia and Azerbaijan since 2020 broke out in late September, killing more than 200 people.

402.title: It's bad, this Champions League is being cruel to us: Barca manager Xavi
402.article_body: Barcelona manager Xavi Hernandez said the ongoing Champions League is being "cruel" to them after they played out a 3-3 draw against Inter Milan on Wednesday night. Barcelona, with a single win in four games so far, are facing elimination at the group stage for the second consecutive season. "What is left for us is to...focus on LaLiga," added Xavi.
